ba'u nai,discursive: 
{ba'u } - exaggeration
{ba'u cu'i} - accuracy
{ba'u nai} - understatement.,,cmavo-compound,understatement,,,UI*3
column776: baurgusuve,$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''gsw'' (Swiss German).,Cf. {dotybau}, {bandu'e'u}.,fu'ivla,German,Swiss German,,baurgusuve
column777: baurnu'a'u,$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''nau'' (Nauru, Nauruan).,See also {bangu},fu'ivla,Nauru,,baurnu'a'u
column778: baurnujenu,$x_1$ is the language with ISO 639-3 code ''nyn'' (Nkore, Nyankore, Nyankole, Nkole, Orunyankore, Orunyankole, Runyankore, Runyankole).,See also {bangu},fu'ivla,Nkole,Nkore,Nyankole,Nyankore,,baurnujenu
column781: bangrvietnama,$x_1$ is the Vietnamese language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).,Cf. {xazdo}, {bangu}.,obsolete fu'ivla,Vietnamese,,bangrvietnama
column782: bergamia,$x_1$ is a bergamot orange of variety/cultivar $x_2$,,obsolete fu'ivla,bergamot,bergamot orange,,bergamia
column786: bitmu,$x_{1}$ is a wall/fence separating $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$ (unordered) of/in structure $x_{4}$.,See also {jbini}, {sepli}, {fendi}, {canko}, {drudi}, {kumfa}, {loldi}, {senta}, {snuji}, {pagre}, {gacri}, {kuspe}, {marbi}, {vorme}.,gismu,wall,,bim,bi'u,bitm,bitmu
column787: blabi,$x_{1}$ is white/very-light colored [color adjective].,Pale forms of other colors are a compound of white; e.g. pink (= {labyxu'e}, {xunblabi}) (whereas kandi is used for pale = dimness, lack of intensity).  See also {skari}, {xekri}, {grusi}, {kandi}, {manku}, {carmi}, {bakri}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.,gismu,white,,lab,blab,blabi
column788: blaci,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains glass of composition including $x_{2}$.,See also {kabri}.,gismu,glass,,blac,blaci
column790: bliku,$x_{1}$ is a block [3-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, surfaces/sides $x_{3}$.,$x_3$ sides/surfaces should include number, size, and shape; also polyhedron (= {pitybli} having flat/planar sides/surfaces).  regular polyhedron (= {kubybli}, {blikubli}), brick (= {kitybli}); See also {tapla}, {kubli}, {tanbo}, {canlu}, {kojna}, {sefta}, {bolci}, {kurfa}, {tarmi}.,gismu,block,,bli,blik,bliku
column791: bloti,$x_{1}$ is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.,See also {falnu}, {fulta}, {marce}, {jatna}, {sabnu}.,gismu,boat,,lot,blo,lo'i,blot,bloti
column792: bolci,$x_{1}$ is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a spherical object [made of $x_{2}$].,Also round.  See also {bliku}, {cukla}, {bidju}, {gunro}.,gismu,ball,,bol,boi,bolc,bolci
column793: bongu,$x_{1}$ is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function $x_{2}$ in body of $x_{3}$; [metaphor: calcium].,$x_2$ is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le <body-part>); cartilage/gristle (= {ranbo'u}), skeleton (= {bogygreku}).  See also {greku}, {denci}, {jirna}, {sarji}.,gismu,bone,,bog,bo'u,bong,bongu
column794: botpi,$x_{1}$ is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$ with lid $x_{4}$.,See also {baktu}, {lante}, {patxu}, {tansi}, {tanxe}, {vasru}, {gacri}.,gismu,bottle,,bot,bo'i,botp,botpi
column795: boxfo,$x_{1}$ is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {plita}, {cinje}, {polje}, {slasi}, {tinci}.,gismu,sheet,,bof,bo'o,boxf,boxfo
column796: boxna,$x_{1}$ is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium $x_{2}$, wave-form $x_{3}$, wave-length $x_{4}$, frequency $x_{5}$.,See also {slilu}, {dikni}, {cinje}, {polje}, {morna}, {canre}.,gismu,wave,,bon,bo'a,boxn,boxna
column797: bradi,$x_{1}$ is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of $x_{2}$ in struggle $x_{3}$.,See also {damba}, {jamna}, {darlu}, {pendo}, {fapro}, {gunta}, {sarji}, {jivna}, {jinga}.,gismu,enemy,,brad,bradi
column798: bratu,$x_{1}$ is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including $x_{2}$.,This is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi.  See also {carvi}, {snime}, {bisli}, {tcima}.,gismu,hail,,brat,bratu
column799: budjo,$x_{1}$ pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {latna}, {lijda}.,gismu,Buddhist,,buj,bu'o,budj,budjo
column800: bukpu,$x_{1}$ is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material $x_{2}$.,See also {mapni}, {matli}, {sunla}, {slasi}, {silka}.,gismu,cloth,,buk,bu'u,bukp,bukpu
column801: bumru,$x_{1}$ is foggy/misty/covered by a fog/mist/vapor of liquid $x_{2}$.,See also {djacu}, {carvi}, {danmo}, {lunsa}, {tcima}, {gapci}.,gismu,fog,,bum,bumr,bumru
column802: bunda,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (def. 1) local weight unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, subunits [e.g. ounces] $x_{4}$.,(additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {grake}, {junta}, {tilju}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {kramu}.,gismu,pound,,bud,bund,bunda
column804: burcu,$x_{1}$ is a brush for purpose $x_{2}$ (event) with bristles $x_{3}$.,See also {komcu}, {pinsi}.,gismu,brush,,bru,burc,burcu
column806: canci,$x_{1}$ vanishes/disappears from location $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ ceases to be observed at $x_{2}$ using senses/sensor $x_{3}$.,Also leaves, goes away (one sense).  See also {cliva}, {ganse}, {zgana}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.,gismu,vanish,,canc,canci
column807: cando,$x_{1}$ is idle/at rest/inactive.,“in motion”, not implying a change in location, is negation of this: {narcando}. See also {surla}.,gismu,idle,,cad,cand,cando
column808: cange,$x_{1}$ is a farm/ranch at $x_{2}$, farmed by $x_{3}$, raising/producing $x_{4}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is agrarian.,Also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops.  See also {purdi}, {nurma}, {ferti}, {foldi}, {xarju}.,gismu,farm,,cag,cang,cange
column809: canja,$x_{1}$ exchanges/trades/barters commodity $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$, $x_{4}$ is a trader/merchant/businessman.,Also (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_4$ is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}).  $x_2$/$x_3$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle}),gismu,exchange,trade,,caj,canj,canja
column810: canko,$x_{1}$ is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure $x_{2}$.,See also {vorme}, {bitmu}, {ganlo}, {murta}, {pagre}, {kevna}, {jvinu}, {kalri}, {kuspe}.,gismu,window,,ca'o,cank,canko
column811: canlu,$x_{1}$ is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by $x_{2}$.,Also occupy (= selca'u). See also {kensa}, {bliku}, {kumfa}, {kevna}, {kunti}, {tubnu}, {dekpu}.,gismu,space,,cal,ca'u,canl,canlu
column812: canpa,$x_{1}$ is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging $x_{2}$.,See also {kakpa}, {guska}, {tutci}.,gismu,shovel,,cna,canp,canpa
column813: canre,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.,Also abrasive (= {gukcanre}).  See also {bidju}, {rokci}, {zalvi}, {boxna}.,gismu,sand,,can,canr,canre
column814: canti,$x_{1}$ is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of $x_{2}$.,Metaphor: process hub.  See also {betfu}.,gismu,gut,intestines,,cant,canti
column815: carce,$x_{1}$ is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.,See also {karce}, {xislu}, {marce}, {matra}.,gismu,cart,,carc,carce
column817: cidja,$x_{1}$ is food/feed/nutriment for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is edible/gives nutrition to $x_{2}$.,See also {citka}, {nitcu}, {pinxe}, {xagji}, {cpina}.,gismu,food,nutriment,,dja,cidj,cidja
column818: cidni,$x_{1}$ is a/the knee/elbow/knuckle [hinged joint, body-part] of limb $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.,Metaphor: a sharp bend/curve. See also {korcu}, {jarco}, {jganu}.,gismu,knee,,cid,cidn,cidni
column819: cidro,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H); [metaphor: light, flammable].,See also {gapci}, {xukmi}.,gismu,hydrogen,,dro,cidr,cidro
column820: cifnu,$x_{1}$ is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species $x_{2}$.,Also infantile.  See also {makcu}, {verba}.,gismu,baby,infant,,cif,cifn,cifnu
column821: cigla,$x_{1}$ is a/the gland [body-part] secreting $x_{2}$, of body $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ is a secretion of $x_{1}$.,Secretion (= {selcigla}).  See also {vikmi}, {xasne}.,gismu,gland,,cig,cigl,cigla
column823: cikre,$x_{1}$ repairs/mends/fixes $x_{2}$ for use $x_{3}$.,A repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of $x_2$, hence $x_3$.  See also {cfila}, {spofu}.,gismu,repair,,cikr,cikre
column824: ciksi,$x_{1}$ (person) explains $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) to $x_{3}$ with explanation $x_{4}$ (du'u).,Explanation $x_4$ is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for $x_2$ (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause.  See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.,gismu,explain,,cki,ciks,ciksi
column826: cilmo,$x_{1}$ is moist/wet/damp with liquid $x_{2}$.,See also {litki}, {lunsa}, {sudga}.,gismu,moist,wet,,cim,cilm,cilmo
column827: cilre,$x_{1}$ learns $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ from source $x_{4}$ (obj./event) by method $x_{5}$ (event/process).,See also {ctuca}, {tadni}, {djuno}, {ckule}.,gismu,learn,,cli,cilr,cilre
column828: cilta,$x_{1}$ is a thread/filament/wire [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.,See also {fenso}, {nivji}, {skori}, {silka}.,gismu,thread,,cil,cilt,cilta
column829: cimde,$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a dimension of space/object $x_{2}$ according to rules/model $x_{3}$.,See also {morna}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {manri}.,gismu,dimension,,cimd,cimde
column830: cimni,$x_{1}$ is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension $x_{2}$, to degree $x_{3}$ (quantity)/of type $x_{3}$.,Also everlasting, eternity, (= {cimnytei}), eternal (= {cimnyteikai} or {temcimni}). See also {vitno}, {renvi}, {munje}, {fanmo}, {sisti}.,gismu,infinite,,cimn,cimni
column831: bi'u,discursive: \n{bi'u} - newly introduced information\n{bi'unai} - previously introduced information.,See also {nindatni}, {saurdatni}.,cmavo,new information,,,UI3a
column832: bo,short scope joiner; joins various constructs with shortest scope and right grouping.,Cf. {ke}, {ke'e}.,cmavo,short scope link,,bor,BO
column833: boi,elidable terminator: terminate numeral or letteral string.,,cmavo,end number or lerfu,,,BOI
column834: bu,convert any single word to BY.,,cmavo,word to lerfu,,bus,bu'i,BU
column835: bu'a,logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 1.,,cmavo,some selbri 1,,bul,GOhA
column836: bu'e,logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 2.,,cmavo,some selbri 2,,,GOhA
column837: bu'i,logically quantified predicate variable: some selbri 3.,,cmavo,some selbri 3,,,GOhA
column838:
bu'o,attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o} - start emotion
{bu'ocu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'onai} - end emotion.,,cmavo,start emotion,,,UI7
column839: bu'u,location tense relation/direction; coincident with/at the same place as; space equivalent of ca.,,cmavo,at,coincident with,,,FAhA3
column841: ca,time tense relation/direction: is [selbri]; during/simultaneous with [sumti]; present tense.,,cmavo,as,during,when,,,PU
column844: ci'e,{ciste} modal, 1st place used in scalar negation    in system/context ...,,cmavo,in system,,,BAI
column845: ci'i,digit/number: infinity; followed by digits => aleph cardinality.,,cmavo,infinity,,,PA5
column846: bunxa,$x_1$ is a $x_2$osity, a $x_2$onger, an absolute $x_2$ I tell you (augmentative),Proposed rafsi -bu or -xa. See {mabla}, {zabna}, {barda},experimental gismu,,,bunxa
column847: buvla,$x_1$ (quoted text) is a “bu letteral” of character $x_2$ (zoi quote).,,experimental gismu,bu letteral,,buvla
column848: cimle,$x_1$ is cute/adorable to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$ according to aesthetic $x_4$.,"{melbi}" frame.,experimental gismu,adorable,cute,,cimle
column849: brazda,$x_1$ is a mansion/manor/large house of/for $x_2$, big by standard $x_3$,,lujvo,manor,mansion,
column850: braze'a,$z_1$=$b_1$ grows in property $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.,Cf. {barda}, {zenba}, {cmaze'a}, {brabi'o}.,lujvo,grow,
column851: brazengau,$g_1$ causes $z_1$=$b_1$ to increase in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.,Cf. {barda}, {zenba}, {gasnu}, {cmajdikygau}.,lujvo,increase,
column852: brazgu,$r_1$=$b_1$ is a rose (Rosa gigantea) of species/strain $r_2$.,,lujvo,rose,
column854: brazo,$x_{1}$ reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {porto}, {ketco}.,gismu,Brazilian,,raz,braz,brazo
column856: bridi,$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_{2}$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_{3}$.,Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places).  ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.,gismu,predicate,,bri,brid,bridi
column857: brife,$x_{1}$ is a breeze/wind/gale from direction $x_{2}$ with speed $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ blows from $x_{2}$.,See also {tcima}.,gismu,breeze,wind,,bif,bi'e,brif,brife
column858: briju,$x_{1}$ is an office/bureau/work-place of worker $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.,See also {jibri}, {gunka}.,gismu,office,,bij,brij,briju
column859: brito,$x_{1}$ reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,See also {glico}, {skoto}, {merko}, {ropno}.,gismu,British,,rit,brit,brito
column860: broda,1st assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).,See also cmavo list {bu'a}.,gismu,predicate var 1,,rod,brod,broda
column861: brode,2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).,,gismu,predicate var 2,,bo'e,brode
column862: brodi,3rd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).,,gismu,predicate var 3,,brodi
column863: brodo,4th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).,,gismu,predicate var 4,,brodo
column864: brodu,5th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).,,gismu,predicate var 5,,brodu
column865: bruna,$x_{1}$ is brother of/fraternal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necess. biological].,See also {mensi}, {tunba}, {tamne}, {famti}, {bersa}.,gismu,brother,,bun,bu'a,brun,bruna
column866: bitni,$x_1$ is measured in $x_2$ (number, default 1) bits/shannons (unit of data/information) of logarithmic base $x_3$ (default 2),See {skami}, {datni}, {bitnymei}, {baitni} // Decimal prefixed forms (powers of 1000): {ki'orbitni} {megbitni} {gigbitni} {tetybitni} {petybitni} {xexybitni} {zepybitni} {gotybitni} // Binary prefixed forms (powers of 1024): {kirbibitni} {merbibitni} {girbibitni} {terbibitni} {perbibitni} {xerbibitni} {zerbibitni} {gorbibitni} // $x_3$ is for defining units with bases other than 2, e.g. trits ({bitnrci}), nats ({bitnrte'o}), dits/bans/hartleys ({bitnrdau}),experimental gismu,bit,shannon,,bitni
column867: blina,$x_1$ is blind under condition $x_2$,from Proto-Germanic blindaz,experimental gismu,blind,,blina
column868: blolo,$x_1$ is a pineapple/member of genus Ananas of species/variety $x_2$,菠萝 Mandarin "bōluó"; Cantonese "bo1lo4" (pineapple),experimental gismu,,,blolo
column869: boske,$x_1$ is a forest of components $x_2$,,experimental gismu,forest,,boske
column870: bravi,$x_1$ is acclaimed/praised for achievement $x_2$ by $x_3$ via noise/gesture/method of praise  $x_4$,Not just vocal cheering. See also: ".{ui'o}".,experimental gismu,acclaim,bravo,cheer,,bravi
column871: brivo,$x_1$ is a predicate word defined as such by its word shape, signifying relation $x_2$ (n-ary property) in language $x_3$,In Lojban, this encompasses {gismu} + {lujvo} + {zi'evla}, but excludes pro-bridi, which are {cmavo}.,experimental gismu,predicate word,,brivo
column872: binryve'u,$v_1$ sells insurance $v_2$=$b_1$ to client $v_3$=$b_2$ for cost $v_4$, insurance against peril $b_3$ (event) providing benefit(s) $b_4$ (event).,,lujvo,insurance agent,insurance broker,insurance salesman,
column873: bisri'e,$x_1$ is a glacier of land mass $x_2$, draining snowshed $x_3$ into $x_4$.,Cf. {bisma'a}.,lujvo,glacier,
column874: bitnymei,$x_1$ is measured in $x_2$ (default 1) bit-groups, each consisting of $x_3$ bits of logarithmic base $x_4$,See {bitni}, {baitni}. // $x_4$ = $bitni_3$,lujvo,bit-groups,
column875: bitybi'o,$x_1$=$bin_1$=$bir_1$ becomes certain that $x_2$=$bir_2$ under conditions $x_3$=$bin_3$.,See also {birti}, {binxo}, {sezybitygau}.,lujvo,become sure,
column877: bitygau,$g_1$ convinces/persuades $b_1$ that $b_2$ is true.,from {birti} {gasnu}. See {termu'igau} for another sense of "convince/persuade". c.f. {madysku} {dragau},lujvo,convert,convince,persuade,win over,
column879: bityvelcki,$x_1$ is a theory about x2 (event/state/property) to $x_3$ by $x_4$,from {birti} + {velcki},lujvo,theory,
column880: bi'umra,$m_1$=$b_1$ is a rampart/bulwark/wall/fence protecting $m_2$ from danger/threat $m_3$, physically separating/partitioning $b_2$ from $b_3$ (unordered), of/in structure $b_4$.,The method by which $x_1$ protects $x_2$ is unspecified. It may, for example, physically block $x_3$ from reaching $x_2$, or it may simply give $x_2$ the high ground it needs to protect itself.,lujvo,bulwark,rampart,
column882: bivma'i,$x_1$ is August/the eighth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,,lujvo,August,Marcheshvan,
column883: bivmasti,$x_1$ is August/the eighth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,Duration. For date, use {masnbi}. Cf. {pavmasti}, {nanca}.,lujvo,August,Marcheshvan,
column884: bivmoija'a,$j_1$ has the rank of Lieutenant General/Vice Admiral/Air Marshal (equivalent of NATO OF-8) in military unit /organization $j_2$.,Cf. {bi}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {sozmoija'a}, {zelmoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.,lujvo,Air Marshal,Lieutenant General,Vice Admiral,Vice-Admiral,
column885: bivykulpikta,$p_1$ is a doctoral degree or equivalent education diploma entitling $p_2$ to entitlement/privilege $p_3$ (event/state) from school/institute/academy $c_1$ teaching subject(s) $c_3$.,Eight level of International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED).,lujvo,Doctoral Degree,Doctorate,
column886: bivyplini,$p_1$ is the eighth closest planet (default is Neptune if p2 is the Sun) revolving around $p_2$ (default is the Sun), with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.,Cf. {pavyplini}, {relplini} etc., {terdi}, {solri}, {mluni}, {lunra}, {plinycma}, {tarci'e}.,lujvo,Neptune,
column887: bixma'u,$b_1$=$m_1$ is adolescent / pubescent / maturing in development-quality $m_2$ (ka) by standard $x_3$.,Cf. {binxo}, {makcu}, {xadbixma'u}, {bavyfarvi}, {citnau}.,lujvo,adolescent,maturing,pubescent,
column888: bixycinki,$x_1$ is an insect with complete metamorphosis,A member of taxon Holometabola/Metabola/Oligoneoptera. See {cinki}, {nalcycinki}, {iupna},lujvo,,
column889: bixycmaci,$c_1$ is a calculus of type/describing $c_2$,See also {cmaci}, {binxo}, {ra'irsumji} and {cneparbi},lujvo,calculus,
column891: blacindu,$x_1$ is a white oak (Quercus alba) of species/strain $x_2$.,,lujvo,white oak,
column892: blacybo'i,$bo_1$ is a glass bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for $bo2_2$ with lid $bo_4$.,,lujvo,glass bottle,
column893: bladei,$x_1$ is Friday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.,Synonyms: {jimdei}, {mumdei}. See also {cicnydei}, {zirdei}.,lujvo,Friday,
column894: bladembi,$x_1$ is indigo (Indigofera sp.) of species/variety $x_2$.,Cf. {zirpu}, {blanu}, {me'andi}.,lujvo,indigo,
column895: blajba,$x_1$ is a blueberry of species/variety $x_2$.,,lujvo,blueberry,
column896: blajinme,$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of indium (In).,,lujvo,,
column897: blakanla,$x_1$ is an eye of $x_2$ and has a blue iris,This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL,lujvo,blue eye,
column899: blaselkanla,$x_1$ has blue eyes,This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL,lujvo,blue-eyed,
column900: blasmela,$x_1$ is a sloe [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$,Cf. {smela},lujvo,sloe,
column901: blasodna,$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of caesium (Cs).,,lujvo,,
column902: blazilska,$x_1$ is the abstract color blue,The gismu {blanu} refers to objects which are blue, but not the color blue itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska},lujvo,blue,
column903: blefa'u,$x1$=$r1$=$f1$ droops to $x2$=$f2$ from $x3$=$f3$ in frame of reference $x4$=$f4$,,lujvo,droops,
column904: blemau,$x_1$ is weaker than $x_2$ in property $x_3$ by margin $x_4$.,,lujvo,weaker,
column905: bleme'a,$x_1$ is less weak than $x_2$ in property $x_3$ by margin $x_4$.,,lujvo,less weak,
column908: briga'e,$x_1$ perceives that $x_2$ is the case (inference from perception).,,lujvo,,
column909: brije'u,$x_1$ (predicate) is true when applied to argument list $x_2$ (sequence),Synonymous to {zilbri}. The x1 slot can be filled with a property/relation (ka) whose number of free slots match the length of the sequence x2. It can also be filled with a bridi abstraction (du'u) —nullary predicate—, in which case the x2 should be the empty set or possibly {zi'o}. See also {bridi}.,lujvo,,
column910: brije'uju'o,$x_1$ knows what sumti satisfies the predicate $x_2$,See also {brije'u}, {kucli}.,lujvo,,
column911: brika'i,$x_1$ is a pro-bridi representing predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.,Cf. {bridi}, {krati}, {sumka'i}, {cei}.,lujvo,pro-bridi,
column912: brili'e,$x_1$ is a prenex of bridi/predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.,Cf. {zo'u}.,lujvo,prenex,
column913: brilogji,$l_1$ [rules/methods] is a predicate logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $l_2$ (du'u) with predicate relationships $b_1$.,,lujvo,predicate logic,
column914: brima'o,$x_1$=$c_1$ (zo) is a cmavo with a predicate role or semantic structure which expresses predicate $x_2$=$b_1$ (quote/du'u) between arguments $x_3$=$b_3$ (ordered list), the said cmavo being of form or in category/class $x_4$=$c_2$ in/and belonging to language/dialect $x_5$=$c_3$.,Includes "moi", "du", and any mekso cmavo for a function/operator.,lujvo,predicate cmavo,selbri-like cmavo,
column915: bripre,$x_1$ is a person who has a body that expresses predicate relationships.,{bridi} {prenu},lujvo,,
column916: brirebla,$x_1$ is a bridi-tail of predicate relationship $x_2$ with relation $x_3$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_4$.,Cf. {bridi}, {rebla}.,lujvo,bridi-tail,
column917: brirei,$c_1$ is a question asking for a predicate, asked by $c_3$ to $c_4$.,In Lojban, this is a question using the word “{mo}”.,lujvo,,
column918: brireisku,$x_1$ asks $x_3$ what arguments satisfy the predicate $x_2$,See also {brije'u}, {ju'odji}, {brije'uju'o}.,lujvo,,
column919: briretsku,$x_1$ asks $x_2$ what sumti satisfies the predicate $x_3$,See also {brije'u}, {ju'odji}, {brije'uju'o}.,lujvo,,
column920: brisni,$x_1$ (text) represents a predicate relationship with relation represented by $x_2$ (text) among referents of $x_3$ that are arguments (sequence/set of texts).,{bridi}, {selbri} and elements of {terbri} are referents of {brisni}, {selbrisni} and elements of {terbrisni} respectively.,lujvo,predicate relationship symbols,
column921: brisnismi,$x_1$ is a subsentence of Lojban grammar.,A subsentence of the official Lojban grammar is put in NU-clause, NOI-clause or gek-gik-clause. The form is similar to a sentence of Lojban grammar, but subsentences cannot be connected to each other by afterthought connectives. See also {brisni} and {simsa}.,lujvo,subsentence,
column922: britirna,$x_1$ induces from their auditive perception that $x_2$ is the case.,,lujvo,,
column923: brivla,$v_1$ is a morphologically defined predicate word signifying relation $b_2$ in language $v_3$.,Derived from {bridi} and {valsi}, deleting $b_3$, as we are speaking of the relationship independent of particular arguments.  In Lojban, such words must end in a vowel and contain a consonant cluster within the first five letters (not counting y).  Not all words that can be used as a selbri (for instance members of GOhA) are brivla.,lujvo,predicate word,
column924: brivlacme,$c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ that morphologically [strict] is brivla $bv_1$ in language $x_5$,The name must strictly be a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x5); as such, in Lojban, the word(s) c1 must end with vowels and in fact must exactly follow the morphology of brivla. See also: {brivlasmicme} (a specialization); {jvocme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x5 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.,lujvo,brivla name,
column925: brivlasmicme,$x_1$=$c_1$=$s_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $x_2$=$c_2$ used by $x_3$=$c_3$ that morphologically [loose] evokes/is similar to/is a brivla $x_4$=$v_1$=$s_2$ (text; may be multiple words), similar in property/quality[/amount?] $x_5$=$s_3$ (ka/ni), in language $x_6$,s3 will likely just be morphological structure. Strict brivlacme are a subclass of brivlasmicme.  The name must "look like" a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x6), but need not exactly follow the morphological requirements thereof (in particular, c1 may end with a consonant in Lojban). See also: {brivlacme} (a specialization); {jvosmicme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x6 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.,lujvo,brivla name,
column926: brivycme,$x_1$ is a brivla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$,{brivo} + {cmene}; see {brivla}. Syn. {brivlacme}. List of common brivycme: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/brivycme,lujvo,brivla-based name,
column927: brodyiolpe,$x_1$ is a mass-individual (myopic singular, Mr Broda); $x_1$, or rather every individual among $x_1$, is logically an individual but represents a plurality and has the properties of what it represents,See {lo}, {gunma}, {krati}, {tu'o},lujvo,mass-individual,
column928: brogu'e,$g_1$ is Israel with people $g_2$ and land $g_3$.,Cf. {gugde'ilu}, {sra'eli}.,lujvo,Israel,
column929: bromalsi,$m_1$ is a synagogue at location/serving area $m_3$.,Cf. {lijda}.,lujvo,synagogue,
column931: broralmalsi,$x_1$=$r_1$=$m_1$ is the First/Second Temple in judaism at location $m_3$.,,lujvo,temple,
column933: brulu'i,$l_1$ (agent) sweeps/brushes $l_2$, removing soil/contaminant $l_3$ with brush $l_4$=$b_1$.,Cf. {denburcu}.,lujvo,brush,sweep,
column935: bruseldamri,$b_1$=$d_2$ is a drum brush for playing on drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] $d_1$ with bristles $b_3$.,,lujvo,drum brush,
column936: bu'ivla,$x_1$ (quoted text) is a “bu letteral” of character $x_2$ (zoi quote).,This term is specific to Lojban. A “bu letteral” is defined as one word which has been made to a letteral with “{bu}”. $x_1$ is a quote (eg. with {lu}…{li'u}) containing the “bu letteral” (including “bu”), $x_2$ quotes the character which the “bu letteral” stands for verbatim, which requires to use a {zoi} quote. See also: {lerfu}.,lujvo,bu letteral,
column937: bujyjbenunsla,$n_1$ is the Vesak celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$.,Cf. {budjo}, {jbena}, {nu}, {salci}.,lujvo,Buddha's birthday,Vesak,Wesak,
column938: bukcilta,$c_1$ is a thread of fabric material $c_2$=$b_2$.,Cf. {skori}, {silka}, {marna}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fenso}.,lujvo,thread,
column939: bukfa'u,$f_1$ parachutes to $f_2$ from $f_3$ using parachute of type/material $b_2$.,Cf. {falbu'u}, {santa}, {vofli}, {bukyvoi}.,lujvo,parachute,
column940: bukfe'a,$f_1$ is a tear in cloth $f_2$=$b_1$ of type/material $x_3$=$b_2$.,Cf. {tafyfe'a}.,lujvo,tear,
column941: buklolgai,$g_1$=$b_1$ is a carpet/rug for covering floor $g_2$=$l_1$ of $x_3$=$l_2$, of type/material $x_4$=$b_2$.,Cf. {lolgai}.,lujvo,carpet,rug,
column942: bukmra,$m_1$ is a tent sheltering $m_2$ from $m_3$, made of cloth $b_2$.,Cf. {bu'uzda}.,lujvo,tent,
column943: bukmu'a,$m_1$ is a curtain/drape for covering $m_2$ and are made of cloth $m_3$=$b_1$.,Cf. {bukpu}, {murta}.,lujvo,curtain,drape,
column944: bukydi'u,$z_1$ is a tent for purpose $z_2$, made of $b_2$.,Cf. {bukmra}, {bu'uzda}.,lujvo,tent,
column945: bukyvoi,$v_1$ paraglides, using paraglider of type/material $b_2$.,Cf. {bukyvoikla}, {bukfa'u}, {falbu'u}.,lujvo,paraglide,
column946: bumgapci,$x_1$ is fog/mist of liquid/composition $x_2$ covering $x_3$.,Cf. {bumru}, {gapci}.,lujvo,fog,
column947: bunspe,$s_1$ is a brother's spouse of $m_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $sp_3$.,Omit $x_4$=$s_2$=$m_1$. Cf. {speni}, {me'ispe}, {tubyspe}, {spebu'a}.,lujvo,brother-in-law,brother's spouse,spouse of brother,
column948: burnanba,$n_1$ is brown bread made from grains $n_2$.,Cf. {labnanba}.,lujvo,brown bread,
column950: burzilska,$x_1$ is the abstract color brown,The gismu {burna} refers to objects which are brown, but not the color brown itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}. EDIT: That should actually say "{bunre}", but I typed in "{burna}" because I'm an idiot.  I didn't correct it in making this edit because the irony is magnificent.,lujvo,brown,
column951: bu'udru,$z_1$ is an awning over $z_2$, made of $b_2$.,,lujvo,awning,
column952: bu'uzda,$z_1$ is a tent inhabited by $z_2$, made of $b_2$.,Cf. {bukmra}, {bukydi'u}, {bu'udru}.,lujvo,tent,
column953: ca'arcadgau,$g_1$ (agent) turns device/apparatus $g_2$=$cab_1$=$can_1$ off.,See also: turn on (={narca'acadgau}), turned off (={ca'arcando}).,lujvo,turn off,
column955: ca'arcau,$cl_1$ is unaided by/without apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment $ca_1$=$cl_2$ for function $ca_2$ controlled/triggered by $ca_3$ (agent).,,lujvo,unaided,unplugged,
column956: by zei sance,$x_1$ is a voiced bilabial stop sound produced by $x_2$.,Synonym: {basnce}.,zei-lujvo,B sound,voiced bilabial plosive,voiced bilabial stop,
column957: bitkoine,$x_1$ is measured in Bitcoin (currency) as $x_2$ (li),,fu'ivla,Bitcoin,,bitkoine
column958: bitnrkrati,$x_1$ (object, event, string, etc.; anything toggleable with $x_2$-many states) represents a bit/shannon/trit/nat (information unit) of logarithmic base $x_2$ (default: 2) where states $x_3$ (ordered list) respectively represent bit states $x_4$ (ordered list; same length as $x_3$),Examples for binary bits (x1 when x2 = 2): a 0-xor-1 string of length one, a coin flip, the toggleable states of an electrical switch, the direction that a car drives down a road, etc.,fu'ivla,representative of a bit,,bitnrkrati
column959: blaiasapida,$x1$ is an ackee (Blighia sapida) of subspecies/cultivar/type $x2$,See also: {blaia},fu'ivla,ackee,,blaiasapida
column960: blandisori,$x_1$ is a quantity of blandissory [food] of composition $x_2$,,fu'ivla,blandissory,,blandisori
column961: blanketi,$x_1$ is a blanket,A heavy, loosely woven fabric, usually large and woollen, used for warmth while sleeping or resting.,fu'ivla,blanket,,blanketi
column963: bi'u nai,discursive: \n{bi'u } - newly introduced information\n{bi'u nai} - previously introduced information.,,cmavo-compound,old information,,,UI*3
column964: blacykabri,$b_1$=$c_1$ is a glass/drinking glass/glass mug/[glass container] with contents $c_2$.,,lujvo,glass,
column965: blikubli,$k_1$=$b_1$ is a regular polyhedron [3 dimensional] with sides/surfaces $k_3$=$b_3$.,$k_3$=$b_3$ sides/surfaces should include number, size, and shape. See also: {kubybli}, {bliku}, {kubli}.,lujvo,regular polyhedron,
column966: blixra,$p_1$ is a relief/embossment representing/showing $p_2$, made by artist $p_3$, on material $b_2$.,Cf. {bliku}, {pixra}, {laryrakpra}, {kacmyxra}.,lujvo,embossment,relief,
column967: bloblobloblo,$x_0$: word used to test the efficiency of a lujvo-building computer program. (nullary predicate),Also anything longer than four syllables of "blo" (rafsi of the gismu {bloti}). The test of building lujvo like these helps distinguish between lujvo building algorithms in polynomial time from those in exponential time, especially given that {bloti} has five rafsi. For example, the sozysozbot jvozba will take a significant amount of time to build the lujvo from eight {bloti}. See also: {bloti}.,lujvo,,
column968: blobonjacta'o,$t_1$=$d_1$=$bo_1$=$bl_2$ is a wakeboard  of material/property $t_2$.,From {tanbo}, {djacu}, {boxna}, {bloti} (bo2-bo5,bl2, bl3 subsumed). See also sufingboard (={bonjacta'o}), windsurfingboard (={fanjacta'o}), kitesurfingboard (={volfanjacta'o}), wakesurfingboard (={blobonjacta'o}).,lujvo,wakeboard,
column969: bloca'ega'a,$g_1$=$c_2$=$b_3$ is a punting pole made of $g_2$ pushed by $c_2$ in boat $b_1$.,Cf. {bloti}, {catke}, {grana}, {blocpuga'a}, {blofanga'a}, {blopinfanga'a}, {blomatryga'a}, {blofarga'a}.,lujvo,pole,punting pole,
column970: blocpuga'a,$g_1$=$l_2$=$b_3$ is an oar made of $g_2$ pulled by $l_2$ in boat $b_1$.,Cf. {bloti}, {lacpu}, {grana}, {bloca'ega'a}, {blofanga'a}, {blopinfanga'a}, {blomatryga'a}, {blofarga'a}.,lujvo,oar,
column971: blocra,$c_1$ is a prow of boat/ship $c_2$=$b_1$, boat for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.,,lujvo,prow,
column972: blocripu,$x_1$=$c_1$ is a dock located on / at $x_2$=$c_2$ connecting boat / vessel $x_3$=$c_3$=$b_1$ to $x_4$=$c_4$,x2 is probably a body of water, but not necessarily (consider air ships or space vessels).  A gangplank is a {zasyblocripu}.  See also: {bloti} {cripu},lujvo,dock,
column973: blofanga'a,$g_1$=$b_3$ is the mast made of $g_2$ of sail $f_1$ on boat $f_3$=$b_1$.,Cf. {bloti}, {falnu}, {grana}, {bloca'ega'a}, {blocpuga'a}, {blopinfanga'a}, {blomatryga'a}, {blofarga'a}.,lujvo,mast,
column974: blofarga'a,$g_1$ is the tiller made of $g_2$ of boat/ship $f_2$=$b_1$.,Cf. Cf. {bloti}, {farna}, {grana}, {bloca'ega'a}, {blopinfanga'a}, {blofanga'a}, {blocpuga'a}, {blomatryga'a}.,lujvo,tiller,
column975: blogre,$p_1$ ferries through $p_2$ to destination side $p_3$ from origin side $p_4$, carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.,Cf. {grebe'i}, {greblo}.,lujvo,ferry,
column976: bloja'a,$j_1$ is a captain of boat/ship $b_1$ of type/that carries $b_2$.,Cf. {bloti}, {jatna}, {blopre}, {blosazri}.,lujvo,captain,shipcaptain,shipmaster,ship's captain,
column977: blokla,$k_1$ goes/sails/navigates (travels by boat) to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using boat $k_5$=$b_1$.,Cf. {klama}.,lujvo,come by boat,go by boat,navigate,
column978: bloklu,$k_1$ is the maritime culture of nation/ethos $k_2$.,Cf. {xamsi}.,lujvo,maritime culture,nautical culture,
column979: blolei,$k_1$ is a ship type/class within ships $b_1$=$k_2$, with features $k_3$.,Cf. {bloti}, {klesi}.,lujvo,ship class,ship type,
column980: bloli'u,$l_1$=$b_2$ travels by boat via route $l_2$ using boat/ship/vessel $l_3$=$b_1$ propelled by $b_3$.,Cf. {klama}.,lujvo,travel by boat,
column981: blomatryga'a,$g_1$=$b_3$ is the shaft made of $g_2$ of engine $m_1$ in boat $m_2$=$b_1$.,Cf. {bloti}, {matra}, {grana}, {bloca'ega'a}, {blofanga'a}, {blopinfanga'a}, {blocpuga'a}, {blofarga'a}.,lujvo,driveshaft,shaft,
column982: blomuvga'a,$g_1$ is an oar/paddle of boat/ship/vessel $b_1$, of material $g_3$, boat for carrying $b_2$.,,lujvo,oar,paddle,
column983: blopinfanga'a,$g_1$=$b_3$=$p_1$ is a/the boom/yard made of $g_2$ of sail $f_1$ on boat $f_3$=$b_1$.,Cf. {bloti}, {pinta}, {falnu}, {grana}, {bloca'ega'a}, {blofanga'a}, {blocpuga'a}, {blomatryga'a}, {blofarga'a}.,lujvo,boom,yard,
column984: blopofre'i,$x_1$ is a survivor/castaway (one sense) of shipwreck (event) $x_2$,"Castaway" in this sense does not necessarily imply being lost or stranded. See also: {nunblopo'u}.,lujvo,castaway,shipwreck survivor,
column985: blopre,$p_1$ is a sailor of boat $b_1$ of type/that carries $b_2$.,Cf. {bloti}, {prenu}, {blosazri}, {bloja'a}.,lujvo,sailor,
column986: blosazri,$s_1$ maneuvers/is a pilot of boat $b_1$=$s_2$.,Cf. {bloti}, {sazri}, {bloja'a}, {blopre}.,lujvo,boat pilot,maneuver a boat,navigate,pilot,
column987: blosoi,$s_1$ is a marine of military unit $s_2$.,Cf. {bloti}, {sonci}.,lujvo,marine,
column989: blotcana,$t_1$ is a seaport/ferry terminal in transport system $t_2$ for boats/ships/vessels of type $b_2$ propelled by $b_3$.,Cf. {bloti}, {tcana}, {ni'ablo}, {brablo}, {greblo}, {xamsi}, {korbi}.,lujvo,ferry terminal,port,seaport,
column990: bloxadni,$x_1$ is the hull of ship $x_2$,from {bloti} + {xadni},lujvo,hull,
column991: blozeile'a,$l_1$=$b_2$ is a pirate aboard pirate ship $b_1$, stealing $l_2$, which is wrong according to $z_2$.,Cf. {xamsi}.,lujvo,pirate,
column992: bluble,$x_1$ is anemic of type $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.,,lujvo,anemic,
column993: blucri,$x_1$=$cir_1$=$cib_2$ loses blood $x_2$=$cib_1$=$cir_2$ under conditions $x_3$=$cir_3$; $x_1$ bleeds,Cf. {ciblu}, {cirko}, {rinci}, {vikmi}, {sputu}, {xrani}, {cortu},lujvo,bleed,
column994: bluda'emre,$m_1$ is a blood pressure measurer measuring the blood pressure $m_2$ of subject $b_2$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$,,lujvo,blood pressure measurer,
column995: bluda'emretci,$t_1$ is a sphygmomanometer measuring the blood pressure $m_2$ of subject $b_2$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$,,lujvo,blood pressure gauge,blood pressure meter,sphygmomanometer,
column996: blufle,$f_1$ is blood flow/circulation of vital fluid $f_2$=$c_1$ of organism $c_2$, flowing in direction to/towards $f_3$ from direction $f_4$.,Cf. {risna}, {blucri}, {blutu'u}, {labyblu}, {spablu}.,lujvo,blood flow,lymph flow,nutrient flow,
column997: blujisra,$x_1$ is a quantity of blood plasma from people/animal $x_2$,from {ciblu} + {jisra},lujvo,plasma,
column998: blupinxe,$p_1$ is a vampire / drinks blood of organism $p_3$=$c_2$.,p2 and c1 subsumed. Cf. {ciblu}, {pinxe}, {crida}.,lujvo,blood drinker,vampire,
column999: blusfani,$x_1$ is a mosquito/blood-sucking diptera of genus/species $x_2$.,Cf. {marlari}, {civla}.,lujvo,mosquito,
column1000: blutu'u,$t_1$ is a vessel with blood/vital fluid $c_1$ of organism $c_2$.,Cf. {risna}, {blucri}, {blufle}, {labyblu}.,lujvo,blood vessel,lymph vessel,phloem,
column1001: bofkosta,$k_1$=$b_1$ is a cloak/cape of material $k_2$=$b_2$,An essentially flat piece of fabric worn fastened or tied around the neck, and reaching down the back.,lujvo,cape,cloak,shawl,
column1002: bofsnipa,$b_1$=$s_1$ is a sticky patch which sticks to $s_2$, and consists of material $b_2$.,Cf. {blucri}.,lujvo,adhesive bandage,adhesive patch,bandage,band-aid,patch,plaster,sticky foil,sticky patch,
column1003: bofyglajbu,$x_1$ is a kotatsu / korsi [table with heater and hanging quilt] keeping (part of) $x_2$ warm under quilt $x_3$ with heating element $x_4$,,lujvo,korsi,kotatsu,
column1004: bogda'u,$x_1$ is a vertebrate animal of species $x_2$,,lujvo,Vertebrate,
column1005: bogjimro'i,$x_1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains limestone from location $x_2$.,Cf. {bogjinme}, {rokci}.,lujvo,limestone,
column1007: bogyfi'e,$f_1$ is a bony fish (Osteichthyes) of species $f_2$.,See also 'fish bone' (={fipybo'u}).,lujvo,bony fish,
column1008: bogygreku,$b_1$=$g_1$ is a skeleton with function $b_2$.,,lujvo,skeleton,
column1009: bogykamju,$k_1$ is the spine of $b_3$. $b_3$ is a vertebrate.,Cf. {kamjybo'u}, {terbo'u}.,lujvo,spine,vertebral column,

column1016: boirlokra,$x_1$ is a pillbug of genus/species $x_2$,see also {onskide},lujvo,pillbug,
column1017: bolbi'i,$x_1$ is the whole region of space which is between inner sphere $x_2$ and outer sphere $x_3$.,$x_1$ {canlu}. The two spheres need not be mutually concentric, but $x_3$ should enclose at least some portion (and probably: most) of $x_2$ and, without loss of generality, $x_3$ should be radially larger than or congruent to $x_2$; if $x_2$ is not fully enclosed by $x_3$, then the result is the convex hull formed by them or some smoothed version or inflation thereof, minus every point enclosed by $x_2$ (and possibly minus $x_2$ itself). Containment, by $x_1$, of any points belonging to the (surfaces) of $x_2$ or $x_3$ is left vague and may be specified by additional description. Contrast with "{jinrcaibyca'u}", which a thin toroidal region enclosed by a bolbi'i (under the assumption of nesting: $x_2$ being wholly enclosed by $x_3$) and confined approximately to a plane intersecting therewith (and which nearly requires complete enclosure of $x_2$ by $x_3$). Just use "{jbini}" with a path or interval defined by the centers or mutually-nearest surface points of $x_2$ and $x_3$ if $x_2$ is not at least partially enclosed by $x_3$. Use "{neryrelbolbi'i}" if you want to be extremely clear in meaning.,lujvo,region between nested spheres,

column1064: bramlatu,$x_1$ is a big cat of Family Felidae of species $x_2$,Genus {pantera} - 'Panthera (roaring or great cats)': {tigra} - 'Tiger, Panthera tigris Asia', {cinfo} - 'Lion, Panthera leo (Africa, Gir Forest in India)', {djagu'ara} - 'Jaguar, Panthera onca (the Americas)', {pardu} - 'Leopard, Panthera pardus (Asia and Africa)'. Genus Acinonyx: {ingulule} - 'Cheetah, Acinonyx jubatus (Africa and Iran)'. Genus Puma: {parpuma} - 'Cougar, Puma concolor (North and South America)'. Genus {unki} - 'Uncia': {irbisa} - 'Snow Leopard, Uncia uncia (mountains of central and south Asia)'. Genus Neofelis: {iunbau} - 'Clouded Leopard, Neofelis nebulosa (southeast and south Asia)', {di'ardi} - 'Sunda Clouded Leopard, Neofelis diardi (Borneo and Sumatra)',lujvo,,

column1068: brapagjvo,$x_1$ (text) is a lujvo with meaning $x_2$ and arguments $x_3$, and which is constructed from tanru/veljvo $x_4$ such that at least one element of the veljvo is ultimately not a cmavo (including "{zei}", "{ke}"/"{ke'e}", "{bo}", etc.), gismu, or rafsi of such cmavo or gismu.,This is a {lujvo} which is not a {cmapagjvo}. In particular, if any of the ultimate constitutents of its veljvo involve a {cmevla} or {zi'evla}/{zevla}, then the resulting lujvo is a brapagjvo. This term is mutually exclusive with "cmapagjvo".,lujvo,nontraditional lujvo,

column1107: capsidba'u,$b_1$ snarls/growls/roars the threat (utterance) of idea/action $s_2$ at audience $s_3$.,Cf. {ckape}, {stidi}, {bacru}, {capti'i}, {fegba'u}, {fe'ucmo}.,lujvo,growl,roar,snarl,
column1108: capsi'o,$s_1$=$c_1$ is an idea/concept/thought that is potentially harmful to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$.,The being put in jeopardy by the concept is not necessarily the thinker of the concept. For example, the concept of a certain type of terrorist act is not (only) dangerous to the would-be terrorist. 'Thought hazard' has a broader meaning than 'informational hazard' and 'knowledge hazard' ({capselju'o}, {junckape}, {capfatci} or {facyckape} – closely related words), which have to do with dangerous ideas that are true. [See Bostrom (2011).] Synonymous with {sibyckape}, which some may prefer.,lujvo,dangerous idea,dangerous thought,harmful idea,ideational hazard,thought hazard,

column1120: carkemkasygaukepyblikeitci,$x_1$ is a Rubik's toy, being of shape/solid $x_2$ with sides $x_3$ and degrees of freedom $x_4$, made from/composed of $x_5$.,This word may be mildly dispreferred to {carkemkasygaukepyblikemkeitci}. $x_2$ is not restricted to three-dimensional objects (despite the definition of {bliku}). Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.,lujvo,Rubik's cube,
column1121: carkemkasygaukepyblikemkeitci,$x_1$ is a Rubik's toy, being of shape/solid $x_2$ with sides $x_3$ and degrees of freedom $x_4$, made from/composed of $x_5$.,$x_2$ is not restricted to three-dimensional objects (despite the definition of {bliku}). Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.,lujvo,Rubik's cube,
column1122: campana,$x_1$ is a champagne made from grapes $x_2$.,Cf. {vanju}, {fomvanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {koinka}.  For sparkling wines without an AOC designation, use {fomvanju}.,fu'ivla,champagne,,campana

column1127: camgusmis,Robin Lee Powell.,Name Lojbanized according to its meaning.,cmevla,rlpowell,Robin Lee Powell,
column1130: ca'o'a,Contraction of ca'o co'a. Expresses that the event is progressively beginning.,Instead of "mi ca'o co'a viska so'o dilnu", one can say "mi ca'o'a viska so'o dilnu".,experimental cmavo,beginning to,starting to,,,ZAhO
column1131: ca'o'e,mekso 4-nary operator: spherical harmonics on colatitudinal/polar angle $a$ and azimuthal/longitudinal angle $b$ of unassociated order $c$ and associated order $d$.,Usually denoted $Y^m_l (\theta, \phi)$. The Condon-Shortley phase must be prepended to the definition. The normalization is chosen so that the integral over all (solid) angles of $Y^m_l(\Omega) conj(Y^n_k(\Omega))  = \delta(m,n) \delta(l,k)$.,experimental cmavo,spherical harmonics,,,VUhU
column1132: ca'oi,binary operator: complex number from argument and phase, $(r, \phi) \mapsto r e^{i \phi}$,For example, {re} {ca'oi} {pai} is −2, and {pa} {ca'oi} {vei} {pai}{fe'i}{vo} is about 0.7071 + 0.7071i.,experimental cmavo,,,,VUhU
column1133: campania,$x_1$ is a champagne made from grapes $x_2$.,Cf. {vanju}, {fomvanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {koinka}.  For sparkling wines without an AOC designation, use {fomvanju}.,obsolete fu'ivla,champagne,,campania

column1136: carmi,$x_{1}$ is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) $x_{2}$ as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.,Also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi).  See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.,gismu,intense,,cam,cai,carm,carmi
column1137: carna,$x_1$ turns about vector $x_2$ towards direction $x_3$, turning angular distance / to face point $x_4$,Also revolve (= {jincarna}).  See also {gunro}, {jendu}. New definition of {carna} originally proposed by Robin Lee Powell and backward-compatible with the old one. Official definition: $x_1$ turns/rotates/revolves around axis $x_2$ in direction $x_3$.,gismu,turn,,car,carn,carna

column1141: catke,$x_{1}$ [agent] shoves/pushes $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.,Move by pushing/shoving (= {ca'ermuvgau}).  (cf. {danre} for non-agentive force, {lacpu}),gismu,push,shove,,ca'e,catk,catke

column1153: carnensroxi'u,$x_1$ is a flywheel storing energy $x_2$.,A flywheel stores energy by rotating.,lujvo,flywheel,
column1154: carvrama'e,$m_1$ is a bike/bicycle/tricycle/pedal vehicle carrying $m_2$ in/on surface/medium $m_3$, propelled by force $m_4$ transmitted via pedal(s) $c_1$=$v_1$.,Also include hydrocycle (={jaurcarvrama'e} or x3= "lo djacu"), handcycle (x4= "lo xance"), electric bicycle (= "lo carvrama'e be fo si'u lo dicymatra"; not to be confused with motorcycles), cycles with different numbers of wheels and different numbers of riders, etc.,lujvo,cycle,pedal vehicle,

column1164: cavgauri'i,$r_1$=$g_1$ is a rainmaking/ ritual intended to invoke rain $r_2$=$g_2$, by custom/in community$r_3$, with form/rules$r_4$.,Rainmaking is an ethnographic term for rituals intended to invoke rain. Raindancing (=lo nu cavgari'i dansu).,lujvo,rainmaking,

column1169: cavykosta,$k_1$ is a raincoat of material $k_2$, protecting from rain $c_1$.,Cf. {tcima}, {bandu}.,lujvo,mackintosh,raincoat,

column1171: cazgau,$x_1$ actualizes $x_2$ (nu); $x_1$ makes $x_2$ actually happen; $x_1$ makes $x_2$ a reality,See {ca'a}, {gasnu}, {cazyfau}, {placazgau},lujvo,actualize,
column1172: cazyfau,$f_1$ is actual (existing in act or reality, not just potentially).,See also {ca'a}, {fasnu}, {jetnu}, {pusfau}, {faurnu'o}.,lujvo,actual,

column1176: ce'a zei ciste,$x_{1}$ (mass) is a font interrelated by rules or relations $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (full set) displaying $x_{4}$ (property of $x_{1}$).,See also {ce'a}, {ciste}, {lerfu},zei-lujvo,font,
column1177: carnamajga,$x_1$ (li; tensor with units of $kg*m^2$) is the moment of inertia/angular inertial-mass/rotational inertia of object $x_2$ around axis/point of reference $x_3$ in basis/coordinate system $x_4$.,Physics is all about expressing the same thing in different ways in order to gain new insight about it. There are other ways to express a mathematical quantity which is equivalent to this one (much as gravitational charge and inertial mass are mathematically mutually equal but not conceptually identical).,fu'ivla,angular mass (inertial),moment of inertia,rotational inertia,,carnamajga
column1178: carslau,$x_1$ is official, approved by $x_2$, an authority over $x_3$,Synonym of {ca'irselzau}.,fu'ivla,,,carslau
column1179: casnce,$x_1$ is a voiceless postalveolar sibilant fricative sound produced by $x_2$.,Derived from and synonymous with {cy zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.,fu'ivla,C sound,SH-sound,voiceless postalveolar sibilant,voiceless postalveolar sibilant fricative,,casnce

column1188: ca'ynaMES,Shahnameh,The Persian epic poem written by Ferdowsi ({la} {ferdoSIS}).,cmevla,Book of Kings,Shahnameh,
column1189: cau'a,elliptical/unspecified truth value; "maybe, maybe not",{cau'i}, but in NA. Indicates unspecificity or uncertainty between {ja'a} and {na}. See {cau'e}.,experimental cmavo,elliptical truth value,maybe,,,NA
column1190: ca'u'e,begin lines of serial dialogue,Usually, the user should immediately precede this word by ".{i}{ni'o}". This word introduces a dialogue or series of utterances/expressions, which will usually be unmarked for speaker (although subscripting is available), in a free-floating structure; the result is essentially like an assertion that the subsequent dialogue took place (from the standpoint of needing a selbri for a grammatical expression). Only quotations, text, "{sedu'u}" expressions, "{lu'e}" concepts or similar may be enclosed in the structure which is introduced by this word, ignoring subscripts and parentheticals and similar. The lines of dialogue which constitute the elements enclosed by the produced structure function as in and are serialized as described by the open-ended terbri tail of "{tcasnuue}" (id est: tcasnuue$_i$ for $i > 6$). Use this word in a transcript, or in a book when discussing fast-pased dialogue in which specifying speaker is not necessary/desired and would break the flow, etc. This word/the structure produced thereby is terminated by "{ca'u'o}". The structure is not intended to modify any other constructions and should typically be immediately followed by ".{i}{ni'o}".,experimental cmavo,begin serial dialogue structure,,,CAhUhE
column1191: cau'e,elliptical/unspecified scalar modifier: "maybe, maybe not", modifies next selbri-unit or tag,{cau'i}, but in NAhE. Shortened from {cau'o'e}. See {cau'a}.,experimental cmavo,elliptical scalar assertion,maybe,,,NAhE
column1192: cau'i,modifier / discursive: elliptical affirmative; "maybe, maybe not",Elliptical NAI/CAI. "Maybe yes, maybe no, maybe somewhere in between". Can also modify attitudinals: {uicau'i} = "Maybe I'm happy, maybe I'm sad". See {ju'ocu'i}, {ju'acu'i}, {ju'oinai}, {cau'a}, {cau'e}, {na'i}, {ge'e},experimental cmavo,maybe,,,CAI
column1193: ca'u'o,Terminate "ca'u'e" construct.,Elidable terminator; seldom actually elidable in practice, except at the end of text. See: "{ca'u'e}".,experimental cmavo,end serial dialogue structure,,,CAhUhO
column1194: cau'o'e,elliptical/vague/indecisive scalar affirmer/negator; true neutral/non-committed/uninvolved scalar truthfulness/assertion,Useful for when the truthfulness or falseness of a bridi is undesirable (the speaker makes no firm stance or assumption on the matter). Different from {no'e} in that it does not necessarily select a neutral value on a scale; it merely acknowledges that some value on the scale could be chosen/that the scale exists, but does not choose one (it is hands-off). If one does not want to accuse someone of being or doing something, but wants to talk about it, this word would be used; often can be used for "are or are not".,experimental cmavo,elliptical scalar assertion,,,NAhE
column1195: ca zi,right now,Narrows the scope/meaning of "now" to be relatively more immediate (but it still may encompass a small interval that extends into the objective/physical past and/or future).,cmavo-compound,right now,,,PU*
column1196: ca zu,nowadays, wide sense of "now",The interval that is considered to be "now" by the speaker is relatively large(r).,cmavo-compound,nowadays,,,PU*
column1197: cecla,$x_{1}$ launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$ [propellant/propulsion].,Also: $x_1$ is a gun/launcher/cannon; $x_1$ hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to $x_1$).  See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.,gismu,launcher,,cel,ce'a,cecl,cecla
column1198: cecmu,$x_{1}$ is a community/colony of organisms $x_{2}$.,See also {bende}, {kulnu}, {natmi}, {tcadu}, {jecta}, {girzu}.,gismu,community,,cem,ce'u,cecm,cecmu
column1199: cedra,$x_{1}$ is an era/epoch/age characterized by $x_{2}$ (event/property/interval/idea).,($x_2$ interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; $x_2$ may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.,gismu,era,,cedr,cedra
column1200: cenba,$x_{1}$ varies/changes in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.,Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change.  (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo),gismu,vary,,cne,cenb,cenba
column1201: censa,$x_{1}$ is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $x_{2}$.,See also {cevni}, {krici}, {latna}, {pruxi}, {lijda}, {sinma}.,gismu,holy,,ces,cens,censa
column1202: centi,$x_{1}$ is a hundredth [1/100; $10^{-2}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).,See also {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}, {litce}, {merli}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.,gismu,.01,,cen,cent,centi
column1203: cerda,$x_{1}$ is an heir to/is to inherit $x_{2}$ (object/quality) from $x_{3}$ according to rule $x_{4}$.,Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in $x_2$) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, {posyselcerda} for unambiguous semantics). column1204: cerni,$x_{1}$ is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.,This morning (= {cabdeicerni}); tomorrow morning (= {bavlamcerni}); yesterday morning (= {prulamcerni}, {prulamdeicerni}) See also {vanci}, {murse}, {tcika}.,gismu,morning,,cer,cern,cerni

Proposed rafsi is -cle-.,experimental gismu,group,love,person,,celdi

column1243: cenlitce,$l1$=$c1$ is $l2$ centiliter(s)/centilitre(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $l3$,,lujvo,centiliter,centilitre,
column1244: cenmildje,$d1$ is $d2$ full (centi)milidays (hundred-thousandth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 (centi)miliday) by standard $d3$; d1 is a metric second.,For use with metric time system. (It is not proper in the standard metric system to combine prefixes, but lojban's grouping rules allow for it.),lujvo,centimiliday,metric second,second,
column1245: centre,$m_1$=$c_1$ is $m_2$=$c_2$ centimeter(s) / hundredth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3$=$c_3$ by standard $x_4$=$m_3$.,Cf. {navytre}, {centi}, {mitre}.,lujvo,centimeter,
column1246: cenydje,$d_1$ is $d_2$ full centidays (hundredth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 centiday) by standard $d_3$,For use with metric time system.,lujvo,centiday,
column1247: cermurse,$m_1$=$c_1$ is the dawn of day $m_2$=$c_2$ at location $m_3$=$c_3$.,Cf. {vacmurse}.,lujvo,dawn,
column1248: cermursynalcando,$ca_1$ is matutinal/active during the pre-dawn/early morning $ce_1$=$m_1$.,See also crepuscular (={mursynalcando}).,lujvo,matutinal,
column1249: cersai,$s_1$ (mass) is a breakfast composed of dishes including $s_2$.,Cf. {dormijysai}, {vacysai}, {cerni}, {sanmi}.,lujvo,breakfast,
column1250: cesri'a,$r_1$ blesses/sanctifies $c_1$ in the name of person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.,Cf. {ruxyzau}, {dapma}, {lijda}, {cevni}, {makfa}, {xamgu}, {vrude}.,lujvo,bless,sanctify,
column1251: cesri'isi'a,$s_1$ worships $s_2$=$c_1$, which is holy/sacred to $c_2$=$r_3$, with ritual $r_1$ having form/rules $r_4$.,Cf. {cesri'a}.,lujvo,worship,
column1252: cestu'a,$x_1$ is an expanse of sacred/sanctified/hallowed/holy/consecrated/blessed/venerable land according to community $x_2$ and which is located at $x_3$,,lujvo,consecrated land,
column1253: cesycku,$cu_1$=$ce_1$ is a holy book containing work $cu_2$ by (presumed) author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4$=$ce_2$ preserved in medium $cu_5$.,Cf. {lijda}, {xebro}, {xriso}, {muslo}, {jegvo}.,lujvo,bible,holy book,koran,scripture,
column1254: cesyske,$s_1$ is hieralogy/science of/about sacreds/sacredness $c_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.,,lujvo,hieralogy,
column1255: cesystu,$s_1$=$c_1$ is a holy site to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$.,Cf. {ritli}, {cesri'a}, {cesri'isi'a}, {lijda}.,lujvo,holy site,
column1256: cesyvu'e,$x_1$ is saintly/holy by moral standard/religion $x_2$,See {censa}, {vrude},lujvo,holy,saintly,
column1257: cevycme,$cmene_1$ is a Divine Name of $cevni_1$=$cmene_2$ as known by $cevni_2$=$cmene_3$ which is associated with $cevni_3$; $cmene_1$ is a name of god.,{cevni} {cmene},lujvo,god,name,
column1258: cfabalvi,$b_1$ is entirely in the future of $b_2$; $b_1$ begins after $b_2$.,Cf. {cfari}, {balvi}.,lujvo,future,
column1259: cfaga'e,$g_1$ notices $g_2$ by means $g_3$ under condition $g_4$=$c_1$.,Cf. {ganse}, {facki}, {sanji}.,lujvo,notice,
column1262: cfari'i,$r_1$ is/are the ritual/proceedings for starting/commencing $c_1$[event/state/process] by community $r_2$ with rules $c_4$.,Cf. {cfari}, {ritli}, {cfagau}.,lujvo,commence,start,
column1264: cfasazri,$s_1$ powers up $s_2$ for function $s_3$=$c_1$.,,lujvo,power up,start,turn on,
column1266: cfatse,$x_1$ sits down on $x_2$.,Cf. {co'a}, {cfari}, {zutse}, {nitytse}, {tsebi'o}. Simple {zutse} refers to the act of sitting, whereas cfatse means the act of beginning to sit.,lujvo,sit down,
column1267: cfifa'i,$x_1$ finds fault/flaw $x_2$ in $x_3$ (object/action), of which the flaw causes $x_4$,See {cfila}, {facki},lujvo,criticize,
column1269: cfilyfacki,$x_1$ finds fault/flaw $x_2$ in actions $x_3$ causing $x_4$; $x_1$ criticizes with critics $x_2$ action $x_3$,See {cfila}, {facki},lujvo,criticize,
column1270: cfinytci,$t_1$=$c_1$ is a wedge (tool) of material $c_2$.,Cf. {cfine}, {tutci}.,lujvo,wedge,
column1271: cfinyvra,$v_1$ is a crowbar/nutpick for doing $v_2$, with fulcrum $v_3$, arm $v_4$, and pointed end $c_1$,Any tool with a wedge on the end of a lever, normally with the fulcrum close to the wedge.,lujvo,crowbar,nutpick,
column1273: cfiste,$x_1$ is a "bug-list" / list of discovered flaws in $x_2$,See {cfila}, {liste}, {samcfi},lujvo,bug list,
column1274: ci'ajbu,$j_1$ is a writing desk of material $j_2$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $j_3$, used by writer $c_1$.,Cf. {bijyjbu}.,lujvo,writing desk,
column1275: ci'arfi'i,$f_1$=$c_1$ writes/authors $f_2$=$c_2$ for purpose $f_3$ from existing elements/ideas $f_4$.,Cf. {cfika}, {cukta}.,lujvo,author,writer,
column1277: ci'artadji,$t_1$ is a font/writing style used by $c_1$ to write $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with implement $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.,{tadji} isn't exactly the right word. Deprecated in favor of {ci'artai}.,lujvo,font,
column1278: ci'artai,$t_1$ is a font/writing style used by $c_1$ to write $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with implement $c_4$.,,lujvo,font,
column1279: ci'asku,$cu_1$=$ci_1$ expresses in writing $cu_2$=$ci_2$ for audience $cu_3$ using display/storage medium $ci_3$ with writing implement $ci_4$.,Cf. {ci'arfi'i}, {cukta}, {karni}, {notci}.,lujvo,express in writing,
column1281: cibdei,$x_1$ is a Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.,Duration. For date, use {jednci}.,lujvo,wednesday,Wednesday,
column1286: cibma'i,$x_1$ is March/the third month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,,lujvo,March,Sivan,
column1287: cibmasti,$x_1$ is March/the third month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,Duration. For date, use {masnci}. Cf. {pavmasti}, {nanca}.,lujvo,March,Sivan,
column1288: cibmoija'a,$j_1$ has the rank of Major/Lieutenant Commander/Squadron Leader (equivalent of NATO OF-3) in military unit /organization $j_2$.,Cf. {ci}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {vonmoija'a}, {relmoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.,lujvo,Lieutenant Commander,Lieutenant-Commander,Major,Squadron Leader,
column1289: cibmoixandegji,$xa_1$=$d_1$ is the middle finger of hand $xa_2$=$d_2$ attached to body $d_3$.,See also: {xantamji}, {relmoixandegji}, {vonmoixandegji}, {mumymoixandegji}.,lujvo,middle finger,
column1290: cibnacmei,$x_1$ is a 3-dimensional vector with coordinates $x_2$, $x_3$ and $x_4$.,Cf. {nacmei}, {relnacmei}.,lujvo,vector,
column1291: cibvanci,$x_1$ is a Wednesday evening of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,,lujvo,Wednesday evening,
column1292: cibyca'u,$x_1$ is the volume (3-dimensional space) occupied by $x_2$,See {ci}, {canlu}, {cimde}, {relca'u}, {te'ai},lujvo,volume,
column1293: cibyfu'ivla,$x_1$=$v_1$=$f_1$ is a stage 3 fu'ivla meaning $x_2$=$v_2$, based on word $x_3$=$f_2$ in language $x_4$.,'stage 3 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a word in Lojban as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {pavyfu'ivla} - 'stage 1 fu'ivla', {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla',lujvo,stage 3 fu'ivla,
column1294: cibykarsna,$x_1$ (sound, text) is a triphthong.,See also {zunsna}.,lujvo,triphthong,
column1295: cibykulpikta,$p_1$ is an upper secondary education diploma entitling $p_2$ to entitlement/privilege $p_3$ (event/state) from school/institute/academy $c_1$ teaching subject(s) $c_3$.,Third level of International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED).,lujvo,High School Diploma,Upper Secondary Diploma,
column1296: cibylajyterkruca,$x_1$=$kr_3$ is a three-way intersection of roads $x_2$=$kr_1$=$kl_1$.,,lujvo,three-way intersection,
column1297: cibypeznimre,$x_{1}$ is a quantity of Citrus trifoliata [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain $x_{2}$.,,lujvo,,
column1298: cibyplini,$p_1$ is the third closest planet revolving around $p_2$, with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.,Cf. {pavyplini}, {relplini} etc., {terdi}, {solri}, {mluni}, {lunra}, {plinycma}, {tarci'e}.,lujvo,Earth,Third closest planet,
column1300: cibyslakyvla,$v_1$ is a three-syllable word meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$=$s_2$ with syllables $s_1$.,Cf. {relslakyvla}, {pavyslakyvla}.,lujvo,three-syllable word,
column1302: cibyxilma'e,$m_1$ is a tricycle (propelled, three-wheeled vehicle) carrying $m_2$ on surface $m_3$, propelled by $m_4$,Explicitly implies a propelled vehicle. Parallels {relxilma'e}. {cibyselxi'u} merely refers to a "device".,lujvo,tricycle,trike,
column1303: cicfoi,$f_1$ is an uncultivated field of material $f_2$.,Cf. {ricfoi}, {ricyci'e}.,lujvo,forest,uncultivated field,wasteland,
column1305: cicnybla,$x_1$ is sky-blue [color adjective].,Color between cyan (={cicna}) and blue (={blanu}).,lujvo,sky-blue,
column1306: cicnydei,$x_1$ is Thursday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.,Synonyms: {mudydei}, {vondei}. See also {ri'odje}, {bladei}.,lujvo,Thursday,
column1307: cicnyjme,$j_1$ is a turquoise (gem/polished stone) of type $j_2$ from source material $j_3$.,See also {cicnykunra} (mineral), {cicna} (color), {jemna}.,lujvo,turquoise,
column1308: cicnykunra,$k_1$ is/contains/is made from turquoise of type $k_2$, mined from location/lode/mine $k_3$.,See also {cicnyjme} (gem), {cicna} (the color turquoise), {kunra}.,lujvo,turquoise,
column1309: cicnyri'o,$x_1$ is aqua [color adjective].,Color between green (={crino}) and cyan (={cicna}).,lujvo,aqua,
column1310: cicnyzilska,$x_1$ is the abstract color cyan,The gismu {cicna} refers to objects which are cyan, but not the color cyan itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska},lujvo,cyan,
column1311: cicplise,$x_1$ is a wild apple/crab apple of species/strain/cultivar $x_2$,Not Malus domestica,lujvo,crab apple,wild apple,
column1312: cicpre,$c_1$=$p_1$ is a savage/wild person.,Cf. {cicre'a}.,lujvo,savage,wild man,wild person,wild woman,
column1315: cicyractu,$r_1$ is a hare of species $r_2$.,,lujvo,hare,
column1316: cicyrismi,$x_1$ is wild rice of species/variety $x_2$.,Cf. {dzizani}, {gurni}.,lujvo,wild rice,
column1317: cicyspa,$s_1$=$c_1$ is a weed of species $s_2$.,Cf. {cicyspavi'u}.,lujvo,weed,
column1318: cicyspafoi,$f_{1}$ is a brush/shrubland [field of wild plants] with predominant plant species/cultivar $s_{2}$.,Not neccessarily limited to bushes, this can refer to any expanses of land with wild plants. Cf {spafoi} (without the restriction to wild plants), {foldi}.,lujvo,brush,scrubland,shrubland,
column1319: cicyspavi'u,$v_1$ weeds out plants $s_1$=$c_1$ of species $s_2$ from $v_3$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $v_4$.,Cf. {cilce}, {spati}, {vimcu}, {cicfoi}, {cicyspa}, {cicyspafoi}, {cicycrepu}.,lujvo,weed,
column1320: cidydzu,$ca_1$=$ci_3$ crawls on surface $ca_2$.,Cf. {cidni}, {cadzu}, {cidydzu}, {cidykla}, {reskla}. Similar to walking but without standing on feet.,lujvo,crawl,
column1321: cidytse,$t_1$ kneels on surface $t_2$ on limb $c_2$=$x_3$ of body $c_3$=$x_4$.,,lujvo,kneel,
column1322: ci'erkei,$k_1$ plays game $k_2$=$c_1$ governed by rules $c_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $c_3$.,Cf. {kelci'e}, {ciste}, {kelci}, {nunkei}, {terjvi}.,lujvo,play a game,
column1323: ci'erkeilai,$ke_1$=$kl_1$ has score $kl_2$ in game $ke_2$=$c_1$ governed by rules $c_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $c_3$.,klani3 (the scale of the score) is implicit in the rules of the game.,lujvo,points,score,
column1324: ci'ernunbi'o,$x_1$=$n_1$ is a revolution that a system $x_2$=$b_1$=$c_1$ becomes another system $x_3$=$b_2$=$c_1$ under conditions $x_3$=$b_3$.,{ciste} {nu} {binxo},lujvo,revolution,
column1325: ci'erse'a,$s_1$ installs $s_2$ into system $s_3$=$c_1$.,The installation need not be physical. It can be software installation, for example. (cf. {ci'ertolse'a}, {ci'erse'atci}, {ci'ertolse'atci}),lujvo,install,
column1326: ci'erse'atci,$t_1$ is an installer for installing $s_2$ into system $s_3$=$c_1$.,cf. {ci'erse'a}, {ci'ertolse'a}, {ci'ertolse'atci},lujvo,installer,
column1328: ci'ertolse'atci,$t_1$ is an uninstaller for uninstalling $s_2$ from system $s_3$=$c_1$.,cf. {ci'erse'a}, {ci'ertolse'a}, {ci'erse'atci},lujvo,uninstaller,
column1329: cifku'ita'a,$k_1$=$t_1$ is/are using baby talk/caretaker speech/infant-directed speech (IDS)/child-directed speech (CDS)/parentese to $c_1$=$k_2$=$t_2$ (default: infant/baby) about subject $t_3$ in language $t_4$.,,lujvo,baby talk,caretaker speech,infant-directed speech,
column1330: cifsfani,$c_1$=$s_1$ is a maggot/fly larva of species/breed $c_2$=$s_2$,See also {ciftoldi}, {siktoldi}, {curnu}, {cinki}, {nemtoda}, {lumbrinki}, {tenbriio}.,lujvo,fly maggot,maggot,maggots,worm,
column1331: ciftoldi,$x_1$ is a caterpillar (larva of butterfly or moth - not sawfly) of species $x_2$.,Cf. {toldi}, {cinki}, {sfani}.,lujvo,caterpillar,
column1332: ciftricu,$x_1$ is a sapling of species/cultivar $x_2$,,lujvo,sapling,
column1333: cifxrula,$x_1$ is a flower bud of plant/species $x_2$.,Cf. {banro}, {ba'orzu'e}, {ba'ostu}, {spati}.,lujvo,bud,
column1334: cifybakni,$b_1$=$c_1$ is/are (a) calf/calves [infant cattle/beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $b_2$=$c_2$.,Young cattle of both sexes are called calves until they are weaned.,lujvo,calf,
column1335: cifydatka,$d_1$=$c_1$ is a duckling of species/breed $d_2$=$c_2$.,Cf. {cipni}, {gunse}, {sovda}.,lujvo,duckling,
column1336: cifylisri,$l_1$ is a children's story about plot/subject/moral $l_2$ by storyteller $l_3$ to audience $l_4$.,Cf. {ranmi}, {pemci}, {crida}.,lujvo,children's story,
column1337: ci'irpa'i,$x_1$ [loves/takes great, passionate interest in] $x_2$,e.g. he *loves* football, I *love* Lojban. From {cinri} + {prami}. See {entuzi},lujvo,love,
column1338: ci'izma,$c_1$=$z_1$ is more interesting than $z_2$ to $c_2$ in amount $z_4$.,Cf. {ci'irme'a}.,lujvo,more interesting,
column1339: ciksne,$s_1$=$c_1$ daydreams about $s_2$; $s_2$ is a daydream of $s_1$=$c_1$.,Cf. {nunxumsne}.,lujvo,daydream,
column1342: cikyjunla,$x_1$ is an alarm clock measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.,{cikna}, {junla}, {jdesna},lujvo,alarm clock,
column1344: cimcitsi,$c_1$ is the wet season of year/years $c_3$.,See also {sudycitsi}.,lujvo,wet season,
column1345: cimde'u,$d_1$=$c_1$ is a quantityof/contains/is made of mud from source $d_2$ of composition $d_3$, moist due to liquid $c_2$.,Cf. {jduli}.,lujvo,mud,
column1346: cimdilnu,$x_{1}$ is a cloud with cloud material-moisture $x_{2}$ with cloudy $x_{3}$ with cloud base [elevation] $x_{4}$.,,lujvo,mist,
column1348: cimjirta'u,$t_1$ is a wet suit for wearing by $t_2$=$j_1$=$c_1$ in liquid $j_2$=$c_2$.,,lujvo,wet suit,
column1349: cimjvo,$l_1$ is an implicitly metaphorical lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor $l_4$.,Used to refer to metaphorical lujvo that do not contain any -pev- rafsi (for “{pe'a}”). The word “{cimjvo}” is itself an example of cimjvo. Synonym of “cimjvo” with explicit metaphor: “{pevycimjvo}”.,lujvo,implicit metaphor,
column1350: cimny'efku,$x_1$ is infinitely recursively related to $x_2$ by applying infinite levels of recursion to predicate relation $x_3$ (ka with two ce'u),{cimni} + {efku}. Cf. {ci'i}, {cimny'efku}.,lujvo,infinite recursion,
column1351: cimnyselcmi,$c_2$ is an infinite set with members $c_1$ (incomplete specification).,See also: {tolcimnyselcmi}.,lujvo,infinite set,
column1352: ceinca'e,I declare that the symbol/expression $x_1$ (quote) henceforth has predicate $x_2$ as its meaning.,,fu'ivla,,,ceinca'e
column1353: cekrpolo,$x_1$ is a polo shirt of material $x_2$.,A T-shaped shirt with a collar, typically a two- or three-button placket, and an optional pocket. Cf. {creka}.,fu'ivla,golf shirt,polo shirt,tennis shirt,,cekrpolo
column1354: cekrti,$x_1$ is a T-shirt made from material $x_2$.,See also: {creka}.,fu'ivla,tee,tee-shirt,T-shirt,,cekrti
column1355: cektola,$x_1$ is $x_2$ shekels/tolas in mass by standard $x_3$,Both are about 11.7 g (the shekel being more variable), and both are derived from a word meaning "weigh".,fu'ivla,shekel,tola,,cektola
column1356: cenciia,$x_1$ (knowledge) is science about subject matter $x_2$ based on the Scientific Method $x_3$,Specific to the Scientific Method. Cf. {saske}.,fu'ivla,lore,science,scientific knowledge,,cenciia
column1357: cenmige,members of $x_1$ (ordered set with two members) are related to each other as members of $x_2$ (ordered set with two members) or as members of $x_3$ (ordered set with two members) ... (infinite number of places),See also {kenmige}, {kanmige}.,fu'ivla,,,cenmige
column1359: centaureia,$x_1$ is a cornflower of type $x_2$,,fu'ivla,cornflower,,centaureia
column1360: centero,$x_1$ is in the center of $x_2$,A central subset (of a set or territory). Use {midju} for center point, {kernelo} for nucleus.,fu'ivla,center,,centero
column1362: cercene,$x_1$ is a hornet/yellowjacket of genus/species $x_2$,Any member of Vespinae.,fu'ivla,hornet,yellow jacket,,cercene
column1363: ce'ulno,$x1$ pertains to Acheulean technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x2$ in properties $x3$.,The Acheulean industry spanned so much time and was organized by successive waves of human migrations into various geographical regions, each group introducing its own unique small variations on common Acheulean stone technology themes, that x2 is of particular importance.,fu'ivla,Acheulean,,ce'ulno
column1364: ci'anti,$x_1$ is blank/has no writing on it,,fu'ivla,blank,,ci'anti
column1365: ci'atrau,$x_{1}$ reflects the Xia culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.,,fu'ivla,Xia,,ci'atrau
column1366: ciblrmoru,$x_1$ is myrrh from tree species $x_2$.,Cf. {ciblu}.,fu'ivla,myrrh,,ciblrmoru
column1367: cibrforso,$x_1$ is a/the triforce/Power of the Gods/Golden Triangle consisting of magic triangles $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,Triforce,,cibrforso
column1368: cidjrbene,$x_1$ is a deep-fried choux pastry/beignet/fritter of variety/with ingredients $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,cidjrbene
column1370: cidjrbiko,$x_1$ is biko Philippine sweet rice cake of ingredients/contents $x_2$ of variety/type $x_3$,,fu'ivla,,,cidjrbiko
column1371: cidjrbinsu,$x_1$ is a bingsu/bingsoo (Korean), a Korean ice dessert, with ingredients/style $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,cidjrbinsu
column1372: cidjrbrazmerse,$x_1$ is Philippine "Brazo de Mercedes" dessert of type/variety $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,cidjrbrazmerse
column1373: cidjrburito,$x_1$ is a burrito/Mexican dish of ingredients wrapped in a tortilla including ingredients $x_2$.,,fu'ivla,burrito,,cidjrburito
column1374: cidjrdinugu,$x_1$ is dinuguan, Philippine pig's blood stew in style/with ingredients $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,cidjrdinugu
column1375: cidjrfufu,$x_1$ is fufu, African dough-like food, of type/variety $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,cidjrfufu

column1377: cidjrkusku,$x_1$ is a quantity of couscous of ingredients including $x_2$,,fu'ivla,couscous,,cidjrkusku
column1378: cidjrletcone,$x_1$ is a roasted pig of variety/type $x_2$,Spanish "lechón"; Tagalog "litsón",fu'ivla,,,cidjrletcone
column1379: cidjrmakapuno,$x_1$ is macapuno, coconut sport, of variety/type $x_2$,Philippine dessert "macapuno",fu'ivla,,,cidjrmakapuno
column1380: cidjrmanju,$x_1$ is Japanese manjū with ingredients/contents $x_2$ of variety/type $x_3$,Japanese manjū (饅頭, まんじゅう),fu'ivla,,,cidjrmanju

column1393: ci'erkelrmankala,$x_1$ plays a mancala game $x_2$ with/organized by rules $x_3$ which interrelate game parts (physical or conceptual) $x_4$.,Mancala is a family of games, not a specific version/realization thereof.,fu'ivla,mancala game,,ci'erkelrmankala
column1394: ci'izra,$x_1$ is "curiouser and curiouser" / strange / weird / deviant / bizarre / odd to $x_2$ in property $x_3$ (ka).,Playful synonym of {cizra}, as uttered by Alice in the Lojban translation of Alice in Wonderland. (In the original English, she says "curiouser and curiouser!"),fu'ivla,curiouser,,ci'izra
column1395: cilkane,$x_1$ is a quantity of propane,See {ci}, {alkane},fu'ivla,propane,,cilkane
column1398: ci'i ma'u,number: uncountably infinite of some sort or infinite in the sense of satisfying the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.,An infinite cardinality which is not countable (aleph-0); if the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis (GCH) is rejected, meaning that the only infinite cardinalities are those of aleph-n form (for nonnegative integer n), then this word would incorporate all uncountable infinities (aleph-m for any strictly positive integer m); else, it incorporates those and any infinity which is strictly larger than aleph-0.,cmavo-compound,generalized uncountably infinite,uncountable infinity,uncountably infinite,,,PA*
column1399: ci'i no,Digit string: aleph-nought, aleph-0, the cardinality of the natural (alternatively: integer) numbers,,cmavo-compound,aleph-0,aleph-nought,cardinality of integers,,,PA*
column1400: ci'i no roi,tense interval modifier: countably infinitely many times; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.,Not necessarily discrete or unbounded in time, nor (eventually or otherwise) infinitely frequent; as a set of Lebesgue measure 0, it is definitely not "always" ({roroi}) in most contexts. For a less specific form of "infinitely many times", use "{ci'iroi}". For the R type of uncountably infinitely many times, use "{ci'iparoi}".,cmavo-compound,countably infinitely many times,,,*ROI
column1402: ci'i'o,transfinite ordinal little-omega; if followed by a number, it denotes the ordinal which is little-omega subscripted therewith in English notation,See also: {ci'i'e}, {ci'i'oi}.,experimental cmavo,transfinite ordinal,,,PA
column1403: ci'i'oi,transfinite ordinal little-epsilon; if followed by a number, in English notation, the following number would be denoted by a subscript,See also: {ci'i}, {ci'i'e}, {ci'i'o}.,experimental cmavo,transfinite ordinal,,,PA
column1404: cibrfiorso,$x_1$ is a/the triforce/Power of the Gods/Golden Triangle consisting of magic triangles $x_2$.,,obsolete fu'ivla,Triforce,,cibrfiorso
column1405: ci'i pa roi,tense interval modifier: continuum (R) type infinitely many time(s); objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.,Strictly more times than "{ci'inoroi}" but not necessarily equivalent to "{roroi}" (for example, this word's reference set of times includes bounded intervals (not treated as "{paroi}"/single discrete events) and intervals with gaps). More specific than "{ci'iroi}".,cmavo-compound,continuumly infinitely many times,uncountably infinitely many times,,,ROI*
column1406: ci'i roi,tense interval modifier: occurs infinite times, eternally; objective tense; defaults as time.,,cmavo-compound,infinite times,,,ROI*

column1421: cinri,$x_{1}$ (abstraction) interests/is interesting to $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is interested in $x_{1}$.,Use $x_1$ tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= {selci'i}).  See also {zdile}, {kucli}, {manci}, {kurji}.,gismu,interesting,,ci'i,cinr,cinri
column1422: cinse,$x_{1}$ in activity/state $x_{2}$ exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.,Also: $x_1$ courts/flirts; $x_3$ could be a ka[gender or role], ka[attraction to a gender], or ka[type of activity], etc.; (adjective:) $x_1$ is sexual/sexy; $x_1$ is flirted with/courted by $x_2$ (= {cinfriti}, {cinjikca}). Cf. {gletu}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}.,gismu,sexual,,cin,cins,cinse

column1433: cincizra,$n_1$=$z_1$=$x_1$ is sexually deviant/perverted in activity/state $n_2$=$x_2$ in property $z_3$=$n_3$=$x_3$ to person/by reference point $z_2$=$n_4$=$x_4$; $x1$ is sexually perverted,cf. {cinse}, {cizra},lujvo,pervert,

column1435: cindymudri,$m_1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains oak wood/lumber from oak tree(s) of species/strain $m_2$=$c_2$.,Cf. {cindu}, {mudri}.,lujvo,oak wood,
