column1437: cinfycinfyjvetirxu,$c_1$=$t_1$ is a liliger of breed/variety $c_2$=$t_2$.,The liliger is a hybrid cross between a male lion (Panthera leo) and a ligress (Panthera leo × Panthera tigris).,lujvo,liliger,
column1438: cinfyjvetirxu,$c_1$=$t_1$ is is a liger of breed/variety $c_2$=$t_2$.,A liger is a hybrid cross between a male lion (Panthera leo) and a tigress (Panthera tigris).,lujvo,liger,
column1439: cinfyma'i,$x_1$ is August of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.,Cf. {bivmasti}, {kanbyma'i}, {nanca}.,lujvo,August,
column1440: cinfyta'udansu,$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances lion dance to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ wearing lion costume $t_1$=$c_1$.,,lujvo,lion dance,
column1442: cinjikca,$j_1$=$c_1$ courts/flirts with $j_1$, exhibiting sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.,Cf. {cinse}, {jikca}, {prami}, {pampe'o},lujvo,chat up,court,flirt,romance,woo,
column1443: cinkemprezumpo'e,$x_1$ is sex slavery, the ownership of people for sexual purposes, according to law/custom/system $x_2$.,Not necessarily by a formal system of slavery. Also connotes gendered slavery. Effectively synonymous with {glekemprezumpo'e}.,lujvo,sex slavery,
column1444: cinkycti,$x_1$ eats/ingests/consumes insects/arthropods of species $x_2$.,The eating of insects/arthropods is {cinkyzumcti}; arthropod 'meat' is '{cinkyre'u}'.,lujvo,arthropod-eating,entomophagous,insectivore,
column1445: cinkyctispa,$cit_1$=$s_1$ is a insectivorous plant of species $s_2$, eating insects/arthropods of species $cin_2$=$cit_2$.,See also carnivorous plant (={recyctispa}).,lujvo,insectivorous plant,
column1446: cinkyre'u,$r_1$ is arthropod meat (body-parts regarded as edible) from species/breed $r_2$=$c_2$.,Examples of {cinkyre'u} that are culturally important to humans include lobster-meat, chapulines, witchetty grubs, sago grubs and prawns. Arthropod 'meat' is, of course, eaten by many non-human animals ({nalremda'u}) as well. 'Insectivory'/'entomophagy'/'arthropod eating' is {cinkyzumcti}. An insect- or arthropod-eater is {lo} {cinkycti}.,lujvo,arthropod meat,
column1447: cinkyzumcti,$x_1$=$z_1$ is entomophagy/insectivory, the eating of insects/arthropods of species $x_2$=$cin_2$ performed by $x_3$=$cit_1$.,From {cinki} {zu'o} {citka}. See also {cinkyre'u} 'arthropod meat'.,lujvo,entomophagy,insectivory,
column1449: cinlyze'a,$z_1$=$c_1$ becomes thinner in direction/dimension $c_2$ by amount $z_3$.,Cf. {cinla}, {zenba}.,lujvo,become thinner,thinner,

column1451: cinpampe'o,$x_1$ is a [significant other/boyfriend/girlfriend] to $x_2$,$x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetrical. See {cinse}, {prami}, {pendo}, {cinpa'i},lujvo,boyfriend,girlfriend,significant other,

column1457: ci'onme'a,$x_1$ is a red panda / lesser panda (Ailurus fulgens) of breed $x_2$.,See {ci'onmau}, {jungo}, {mabru}, {arxokuna},fu'ivla,panda,red panda,,ci'onme'a
column1458: ci'onpau,$x_1$ is a steamed bun/siopao with ingredients $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,ci'onpau
column1459: cinfos,$x_1$ is Leo [constellation/astrological sign].,From cinfo (=lion; lojban); leo (=lion; latin). Many civilizations over thousands of years have portrayed the constellation of Leo as a lion.,cmevla,Leo,
column1461: cinkrtenebri,$x_1$ is a mealworm/darkling beetle of species/breed $x_2$ (genus Tenebrio).,Synonymous with {tenbriio}.,fu'ivla,darkling beetle,mealworm,,cinkrtenebri
column1463: ci no gei pa,number: $1*10^{30}$, quetta, nonillion; symbol: Q,,cmavo-compound,nonillion,quetta,,,PA*

column1466: cipra,$x_{1}$ (process/event) is a test for/proof of property/state $x_{2}$ in subject $x_{3}$ (individ./set/mass).,Also examination, proxy measure, validation; (a set in $x_3$ must be completely specified).  See also {ciksi}, {troci}, {jarco}, {pajni}, {saske}.,gismu,test,,cip,cipr,cipra
column1467: cirko,$x_{1}$ loses person/thing $x_{2}$ at/near $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ loses property/feature $x_{2}$ in conditions/situation $x_{3}$.,$x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {po'ecri}, {posyselcri} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {facki}, {ralte}, {sisku}, {claxu}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {binra}, {mipri}.,gismu,lose,,cri,cirk,cirko

Possibly could refer to (especially metaphorically or whn not referencing biological body parts): tweezers, tongs, etc.,lujvo,jaw,mandible,pincer,

column1498: blonaresmi,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'word' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: BAhE? any-word indicators?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,,blonaresmi
column1499: blondino,$x_1$ is blond, fair-haired,Blond is a color special to mammal and human hair.,fu'ivla,,,blondino
column1500: blorkaiaka,$x_{1}$ is a kayak [small, human-propelled boat/ship/vessel vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.,,fu'ivla,kayak,,blorkaiaka
column1502: blurdrakono,$c_1$ is dragon's blood [bright red resin] of plant species $c_2$ (genus Croton/Dracaena/Daemonorops/Calamus rotang/Pterocarpus).,The red resin was used in ancient times as varnish, medicine, incense, and dye. It continues to be employed for the aforementioned purposes by some. Not to be confused with blood from a dragon which is "lo ciblu be lo ranmrdrakono".,fu'ivla,dragon's blood,,blurdrakono
column1503: bluueta,$x_1$ is a cornflower of type $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,bluueta

column1506: boljipe,$x_1$ is a ballpoint pen/biro for applying ink $x_2$,Short zi'evla based on {bolji'openbi}. See also {penbi}, {bolci}, {penbi}, {pinsi}, {ciska}, {cinta}, {pixra}, {jipno}.,fu'ivla,ballpoint pen,biro,,boljipe
column1510: bolrbliiardo,$x_1$ is a billard ball.,See also: {bliiardo}, {bolci}.,fu'ivla,billard ball,,bolrbliiardo
column1513: bolrkriketi,$x_1$ is a cricket ball.,See also: {kriketi}.,fu'ivla,cricket ball,,bolrkriketi
column1516: bolstropfedo,$x_1$ is arranged and to be traced/read in boustrophedon manner, starting at point $x_2$, turning at points $x_3$ (ordered list), and ending at point $x_4$.,$x_1$ need not be a script (for example: it could just be a winding curve/maze/path/pattern, a snake curled up withoutcoiling on top of itself, or yarn while weaving or on a loom). If not orientation is preferred, then $x_2$ and $x_4$ may be mutually exchangeable if the $x_3$ is reversed. See also: {toxsotiseira}.,fu'ivla,boustrophedon,,bolstropfedo
column1517: boltsemaku,$x_1$ is the Boltzmann $k_B$ constant linking energy with temperature [approximately equal to: 1.380 6488(13)×$10^{−23}$ J/K], expressed in units $x_2$ (default: unitless/dimensionless and equal to 1) in paradigm/system/metaphysics/universe $x_3$ (default: this, our actual, physical universe),Introduced by Planck (along with "h", his own eponymous constant); named after Boltzmann who nonetheless laid the foundation for research into such affairs. See also: {stefanboltsemasi} ($sigma_{SB}$), {plankexu}, {tcelerita}, {gravnutnoia}, {avgadro}, {ocnerta}, {nejni}, {kelvo}, {nilgla}.,fu'ivla,1.380 6488(13)×10^(−23) J/K,Boltzmann constant k_B,,boltsemaku

column1526: botrperkolato,$b_1$ is a percolator for coffee $b_2$, made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.,See also: coffeemaker (={kafpraca'a}). For the filter add fifth place (=fi'o julne: x5).,fu'ivla,percolator,,botrperkolato
column1527: botrportcelanu,$bo_1$ is a porcelain bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container made of porcelain for $bo2_2$ with lid $bo_4$.,See also: {stakrportcelanu}.,fu'ivla,porcelain bottle,,botrportcelanu
column1529: braketi,$x_1$ is a bra or ket (mathematical object/notation) meaning/denoting/representing  (object/information) $x_2$ with properties $x_3$,The definition treats bras and kets on equal footing, without distinction (except possibly by x3).,fu'ivla,bra,ket,,braketi

column1534: breveto,$x_1$ is a patent on invention $x_2$ by inventor $x_3$ valid in jurisdiction $x_4$ for time interval $x_5$.,,fu'ivla,patent,,breveto
column1535: breviia,$x_1$ (text) is an abbreviation, short form of word or phrase $x_2$ (text),Newer version of the obsolete form {brevia}.,fu'ivla,abbreviation,,breviia
column1536: brididu,$x_1$ is the relationship between $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, ...,"ko'a mo ko'e ko'i ..." = "ma brididu ko'a ko'e ko'i ...", which is the way that English expresses the concept of Lojban {mo}. See also {bridi}, {du'u}, {mo}.,fu'ivla,,,brididu
column1537: briii,$x_1$ is a quantity of Brie cheese of variety $x_2$.,Pronunciation: BRI,ĭi . See {cirla}, {fraso},fu'ivla,Brie,,briii
column1538: brinefa,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'bridi-tail' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: bridi-tail-1 (gihek stag? KE # bridi-tail /KEhE#/ tail-terms)?. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,,brinefa
column1539: brinesi,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'sentence' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: (terms (CU #)?)? bridi-tail. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,,brinesi
column1540: brinimi,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'subsentence' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: sentence | prenex subsentence. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,,brinimi
column1541: brinimikra,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'prenex' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: terms ZOhU #. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,,brinimikra

column1543: brocure,$x_1$ is a brochure about $x_2$; $x_1$ is paper document informing about $x_2$,Brochure can be folded into a template, pamphlet or leaflet.,fu'ivla,,,brocure

column1545: bromeli,$x_1$ is a bromeliad/pineapple of species $x_2$.,Cf. {grutrxananase}.,fu'ivla,bromeliad,pineapple,,bromeli

column1547: bruneleska,$x_1$ exhibits spina di pesce/Brunelleschi herringbone (zigzag) pattern/design with features $x_2$,Something as simple as the alternating count or specification of the spines can be described in x2 (in other words, the description need not be complete). See also: {zigzagi}.,fu'ivla,Brunelleschian pattern,herringbone,spina di pesce,,bruneleska

column1549: budjrbikuni,$x1$ is a buddhist nun of sect $x2$,,fu'ivla,buddhist nun,,budjrbikuni

column1554: burfava,$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'lerfu-word' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.,Inner structure of the rule: BY | any-word BU | LAU lerfu-word | TEI lerfu-string FOI. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.,fu'ivla,,,burfava
column1555: burgere,$x_1$ is a burger/hamburger.,See also: {cirla zei burgere}.,fu'ivla,burger,,burgere
column1556: burjuia,$x_1$ is a bourgeois, a capitalist who engages in industrial commercial enterprise $x_2$,,fu'ivla,,,burjuia
column1557: ca'arxe,$x_1$ is modern in aspect $x_2$,See also {cabna}, {sarxe}, {cedra}, {cnino}.,fu'ivla,modern,,ca'arxe

column1559: bukurEct,Bucharest, capital city/a major city of Romania.,,cmevla,Bucharest,
column1561: bu'a'a,naturalistic interjection: used to express a fit of overwhelming or uncontrollable laughter; the stereotypical 'evil laugh',Additional -'a syllables may be added as desired. See {u'i}, {le'o}, {xa'a}, {cmila}, {palci},experimental cmavo,evil laughter,,,UI1b
column1562: bu'ai,abstractor: abstractor to create logically quantified selbri variable to be used in predicate logic of third or higher order.,{zo'e} and {da} are a constant and a bound variable of predicate logic of first order respectively; {co'e} and {bu'a} are a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable of predicate logic of second order respectively; in order to express predicate logic of third or higher order, it is essential to have selbri that treat selbri variables in the domain of all selbri of second order. {su'u} and {bu'ai} in selma'o NU can compose respectively a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable in the domain of all selbri of second order. In the case that {bu'ai} takes plural number of selbri variables, connect them with {ju'e} or something. Higher order is also possible by nesting {bu'ai}. Example: su'o bu'ai xe'u kei su'o bu'a ro da zo'u bu'ai da bu'a (This {xe'u} is an abstraction-variable-indicator-{selbrisle} used in order to put a word of selma'o NU in prenex.) See also {su'u}, {bu'a}; {xe'u}.,experimental cmavo,higher order,third order,,,NU
column1564:
bu'o cu'i,attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o } - start emotion
{bu'o cu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'o nai} - end emotion.,,cmavo-compound,continue emotion,,,UI*7
column1565: burgalu,$x_1$ is the boogaloo, danced by $x_2$ to music $x_3$,Place structure based on {dansytai}. See {dansu},fu'ivla,boogaloo,,burgalu
column1566: ca'abna,$x_1$ happens now,Absolute time reference. See also {cabna}.,fu'ivla,now,,ca'abna
column1568: bu'o'e,elliptical/unspecified/vague letteral/symbol,Has use in mekso at the least; in this context, it might subsume {xo'e} (but see: {xo'e'o'e}). It also may be useful in spelling, initialisms, etc. If used as a pro-sumti (as other letters are), it means {zo'e} but only for reasonable or previously specified letterals assignments.,experimental cmavo,elliptical letteral,unspecified letteral,,,BY
column1569: bu'oi,Interjection: Boo!,A way to shock people analogous to yelling "BOO!" at someone.,experimental cmavo,boo,,,COI
column1570:
bu'o nai,attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o } - start emotion
{bu'o cu'i} - continue emotion
{bu'o nai} - end emotion.,,cmavo-compound,end emotion,,,UI*7
column1572: ca'au,Refers to what is usually assumed to be the argument of tense tags when no explicit argument is given,Usually, {pu} {ca'au} means the same as {pu} {ku}. What {ca'au} refers to depends on the bridi operators before it.,experimental cmavo,,,,KOhA7
column1573: ca ba'o,time tense: has been, is now in the aftermath of; (tense/modal).,,cmavo-compound,has been,,,ZAhO*
column1574: cabna,$x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.,(default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.,gismu,concurrent,current,now,present,simultaneous,,cab,cabn,cabna
column1575: cabra,$x_{1}$ is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function $x_{2}$ controlled/[triggered] by $x_{3}$ (agent).,Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically).  (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, {pilno}),gismu,apparatus,,ca'a,cabr,cabra
column1576: cacra,$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard $x_{3}$.,See also {junla}, {mentu}, {snidu}, {tcika}, {temci}.,gismu,hour,,cacr,cacra
column1577: cadzu,$x_{1}$ walks/strides/paces on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.,See also {stapa}, {bajra}, {klama}, {litru}.,gismu,walk,,dzu,cadz,cadzu
column1578: cafne,$x_{1}$ (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard $x_{2}$.,See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list {piso'iroi} and similar compounds.,gismu,frequent,often,,caf,cafn,cafne
column1580: cadga,$x_1$ (abstraction) should/(of right) ought to be true/happening under conditions/in the case of $x_2$ being true/happening, as believed by/by standard/under consideration of $x_3$. If the world were proper/correct/just/ruled perfectly and strictly according to $x_3$ and if $x_2$ were true, then $x_1$ would be true as well.,Moral judgment goes in $x_3$. $x_3$ can also be assumed by expectation under hypothesized laws of physics, by the true situation of the world, etc. Synonymous with {zgadi}.,experimental gismu,ought,should,,cadga
column1581: cadma,$x_1$ is a shaman/medicine man of group/tribe $x_2$,Refers to the religious practices and their practitioner.,experimental gismu,shaman,,cadma
column1582: cabda'o,$x_1$ (nu) happens far away in time from $x_2$ (nu).,,lujvo,far away in time,
column1583: cabdei,$d_1$=$c_1$ is today; $d_1$=$c_1$ is the day occuring at the same time as $c_2$, day standard $d_3$.,Cf. {prulamdei}, {bavlamdei}.,lujvo,same day,today,
column1584: cabdeicerni,$x_1$=$ce_1$=$ca_1$ is this morning; $x_1$=$ce_1$=$ca_1$ is the morning occuring at the same time as day $x_2$=$ce_2$=$d_1$ at location $x_3$=$ce_3$.,Morning (={cerni}), tomorrow morning (={bavlamcerni}), yesterday morning (={prulamcerni}).,lujvo,this morning,
column1585: cabjbi,$x_1$ (nu) happens nearby in time from $x_2$ (nu).,,lujvo,nearby in time,
column1586: cabjeftu,$j_1$=$c_1$ is this week; $j_1$=$c_1$ is the week occuring at the same time as $c_2$, week standard $j_3$.,Cf. {prulamjeftu}, {bavlamjeftu}.,lujvo,current week,this week,
column1587: cabjvezva,$x_1$ overlaps in time and space with $x_2$,See also {cabna}, {zvati}, {mokca}.,lujvo,,
column1588: cabma'i,$m_1$=$c_1$ is the current month by month standard $m_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.,Cf. {cabna}, {pavmasti}.,lujvo,current month,
column1589: cabmoi,$x_1$ is the $x_2$-th one timewise to satisfy property $x_3$ among $x_4$.,Synonym: {temymoi}.,lujvo,,
column1590: cabna'a,$n_1$ is the current year by standard $n_3$, simultaneous with $c_2$ in time.,Cf. {cabma'i}, {cabdei}.,lujvo,current year,
column1592: cabnunzukykezyzga,$x_1$ watches the event $x_2$ unfold before their very eyes/live/red-handed/in flagrante (delicto), using senses/means $x_3$.,No implication of the action being considered improper or discouraged. The event must be an action (lo nu {zukte}), not just an occurrence. "Before one's very eyes" is an idiomatic expression and does not require sight to have been involved, nor $x_1$ to even have eyes.,lujvo,catch in the act,in flagrante,in real time,live,red-handed,
column1593: cabrolmoi,$x_1$ is the last one timewise to satisfy property $x_2$ among $x_3$.,See also {cabmoi} and {temymoi}.,lujvo,,
column1594: cabvanci,$x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is this evening; $x_1$=$v_1$=$c_1$ is the evening occuring at the same time as $x_2$=$v_2$ at location $x_3$=$v_3$.,Evening (={vanci}), tomorrow evening (={bavlamvanci}), yesterday evening (={prulamvanci}).,lujvo,current evening,this evening,
column1596: cabycte,$n_1$=$c_1$ is the night of $c_2$ at location $n_3$.,{cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. See also {nicte}, {bavlamcte}, {prulamcte}, {cabdei}.,lujvo,tonight,
column1597: cabyfau,$c_1$=$f_1$ is live (experienced as it happens) to experiencer $c_2$.,Cf. {cabna}, {fasnu}, {tivni}.,lujvo,live,
column1598: cabyku'e,$k_1$=$c_1$ ranges through time/has duration $k_2$=$c_2$.,$x_2$ is the complete duration as the amount of time or an interval specification and is non-aorist. Cf. {temci}.,lujvo,duration,time,
column1599: cabytcini,$x_1$ is the status quo/current state of $x_2$,from {cabna}+{tcini},lujvo,current state,status quo,
column1600: cacklu,$k_1$=$t_1$ is a tradition/practice/custom of traditional culture $t_2$=$k_2$ under conditions $t_3$,This is similar to {ritli}, but the emphasis is not necessarily on particular rituals, but customs (ex. wearing of a particular type of clothing or hairstyle) associated with a group.,lujvo,custom,practice,tradition,
column1601: cacpli,$x_1$ habitually uses $x_2$ to do $x_3$; $x_1$ is a "user" of $x_2$.,Equivalent to {ta'e} {pilno}.,lujvo,habitually use,
column1602: cacryme'utcika,$x_1$ (number) is the minute/minute notation of the hour, of event/state $x_2$, in system $x_3$.,{cacra} zei {mentu} zei {tcika}. As default, the number $x_1$ is counted from the first minute of the hour. See {ti'u'e} for BAI. ex.) li cino cu cacryme'utcika lo nu mi ti xrukla kei py sy ty (I will be back at thirty minutes past the hour PST.),lujvo,minute of the hour,
column1603: cacryminli,$x_1$ is $x_2$ long local distance units/miles per hour (mph) in speed/velocity.,,lujvo,miles per hour,mph,
column1604: cacryra'o,$x_1$ is $x_2$ hours in angular measure of right ascension RA (default is 1).,Cf. {cacra}, {radno}, {julra'o}, {sostartai}. {pi'e} used in x2 indicates a base of 60.,lujvo,hour,
column1605: cacyjva,$j_1$=$t_1$ is a convention prescribing $j_2$ (event/state) within community $j_3$=$t_2$.,Cf. {ritli}, {lijda}, {malsi}.,lujvo,convention,
column1606: cacysku,$c_1$=$t_2$ customarily expresses $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.,Cf. {tcaci}, {cusku}, {ritli}.,lujvo,customary expression,people who say things habitually; [people who say proverbs, (though that's more like se tcacyselsku)],
column1607: cadycta,$cat_1$=$can_1$ is a lurker/inactively watches $cat_2$,See also: {bebzunpre}, {irci},lujvo,lurks,
column1609: cadysti,$s_1$=$c_1$ (agent) ceases and rests from activity/process/state $s_2$ (not necessarily completing it).,Cf. {lazni}.,lujvo,cease and rest,
column1610: cadytilju,$x_{1}$ is heavy in proper mass, invariant mass, rest mass, intrinsic mass,Related to mass–energy equivalence.,lujvo,heavy,heavy,heavy,
column1611: ca'ermuvgau,$g_1$=$c_1$ pushes $m_1$=$c_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$.,Cf. {catke}, {muvgau}, {danre}.,lujvo,push,shove,
column1612: ca'erslanu,$s_1$ is a valve/piston of material $s_2$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.,Cf. {matra}, {karce}.,lujvo,piston,poppet valve,
column1613: caflitki,$l_1$ is liquid at room temperature/at standard temperature and pressure, and consists of composition/material $l_2$.,Cf. {cafygapci}, {cafsligu}, {djacu}, {margu}, {xalka}, {sligu}, {kelvo}.,lujvo,liquid at room temperature,
column1614: cafrei,$r_1$ is a frequently-asked question about subject $r_2$,,lujvo,FAQ,frequently-asked question,
column1615: cafsligu,$x_1$ is a solid of $x_2$ at room temperature/STP.,STP = standard temperature and pressure. See also {caflitki}, {cafygapci},lujvo,solid at room temperature,
column1616: cagdaidi'u,$di_1$ is a barn for storing/sheltering grains/livestock/tools/machinery $da_1$.,Cf. {grutersro}, {xirzda}, {cange}, {sorcu}.,lujvo,barn,
column1617: cagdalsasfoi,$n_1$ is a pasture with vegetation $s_1$ (mainly consisting of grasses) grazed by animal(s) $d_1$ belonging to farm/ranch $c_1$.,,lujvo,pasture,
column1618: cagda'u,$x_1$ is a livestock/farm-animal kept by $x_2$ of species $x_3$,See {cange}, {danlu}, {dalcange},lujvo,farm animal,livestock,
column1619: cabrspreso,$c_1$ is an espresso machine controlled/[triggered] by $c_3$ (agent).,See also: espresso (={kafrspreso}), barista (={crekafpra}).,fu'ivla,espresso machine,,cabrspreso
column1621: ca ca'a,time tense: present actuality; modal aspect.,,cmavo-compound,currently is,,,PU*
column1622: ca ca'o,time tense: is now/simultaneously, is now in the middle of; (tense/modal).,,cmavo-compound,is now,,,ZAhO*
column1623: cadnfroide,$x_1$ feels schadenfreude/pleasure derived from unfortunate/luckless event $x_2$.,See also {funca}, {gleki}, {zdile},fu'ivla,feel schadenfreude,,cadnfroide
column1624: ca'e dai,discursive / expression: "If you say so",See {ca'e}, {dai}, {vi'o},cmavo-compound,if you say so,,,UI*2
column1625: ca'erbi'e,$b_1$=$c_2$ is a wind from direction $b_2$ with speed $b_3$, shoving/pushing $c_2$ at locus $c_3$.,Cf. {bloti}.,lujvo,wind,
column1626: ca'ercarce,$car_1$=$cat_2$ is a pushcart/wheelbarrow for carrying $car_2$.,Cf. {catke}, {carce}.,lujvo,barrow,pushcart,wheelbarrow,
column1627: cafraina'o,$ca_1$=$t_1$=$cn_1$ is a/the mode [value that appears most often] in property/amount $cn_2$ (ka/ni) among $cn_3$(s) (set) by standard $cn_4$.,,lujvo,mode,
column1628: cafygapci,$x_1$ is a gas of $x_2$ at room temperature/STP.,STP = standard temperature and pressure. See also {caflitki}, {cafsligu}.,lujvo,gas at room temperature,
column1629: ca'engau,$x_1$ defines $x_2$ (nu/du'u) to be true / to happen // $x_2$ is true because $x_1$ says so or thinks so.,Based on {ca'e}, {gasnu}. Near-synonym with {jetrinsku},fu'ivla,define,,ca'engau
column1630: ca'e'ei,Evidential: "because I say so"/"because I assert it to be true"/"it is known".,Maybe also "because I am your parent" in some contexts. The claim is true not because the utterer defines it to be so/has the authority or ability to make it so, but instead simply because they claim it to be true. Useful for dealing with annoying children who ask "why" iteratively; not useful for actually convincing anyone of the claim.,experimental cmavo,because I say so,it is known,,,UI
column1631: ca'ei,shorthand for {ca lo nu}; during the event-of,People who speak the dialect that uses {ca'ei} also use {pu'ei} and {ba'ei} for {pu} {lo} {nu} and {ba} {lo} {nu} respectively. Terminates with {ku'ei}.,experimental cmavo,during,event,,,CAhEI
column1632: ca'ei'a,Unary mekso operator: unit vector/normalization of the argument (vector) X.,Outputs X/|X|, where X is the vector-valued input; this is the unit vector which points in the direction of X. It might generalize to other tensors and the like. The definition of the magnitude/norm/metric is left to context or the explicit definition of the space in which X lives.,experimental cmavo,normalized vector,unit vector,,,VUhU
column1634: cakla,$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa.,See also {ckafi}.,gismu,chocolate,,cakl,cakla
column1635: calku,$x_{1}$ is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around $x_{2}$ composed of $x_{3}$.,See also {pilka}, {skapi}, {gacri}, {bartu}.,gismu,shell,,cak,calk,calku
column1636: ca'i,{catni} modal, 1st place                            by authority of ...,,cmavo,by authority of,,,BAI
column1638: cagna,$x_1$ is a wound on body $x_2$ at locus $x_3$ caused by $x_4$,Unlike velxai, it's specific to physical injuries pertaining to the surface of an organic body such as skin. Open wounds include ka'arcagna for "incision / incised wound", fercagna for "laceration", gukcagna for "abrasion", tuncagna for "puncture wound", grecagna for "penetration wound", batcagna for "bite wound", dancagna for "gunshot wound", jelcagna for "burn", da'ercagna for "bedsore", furcagna for "necrosis"; closed wounds include daxcagna for "contusion/bruise", camdaxcagna for "hematoma", ra'ircagna for "chronic wound".,experimental gismu,wound,wounded,,cagna
column1639: cajni,$x_1$ is a binary operator which is commutative in space/under conditions/on (or endowing) set $x_2$; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are each abelian (in different senses).,Denote $x_1$ by "♤"; for any elements x,y in the set of concern, if '♤' is commutative, then x♤y = y♤x, where equality is defined in the space. "Commutative property"/"commutativity" = "ka(m)( )cajni". See also: {socni}, {sezni}, {dukni}, {facni}.,experimental gismu,abelian,commutative operator,commutative property,,cajni

column1690: baicmvo,$x_1$ (usually Lojban word) is the BAI cmavo corresponding to root word/gismu $x_2$.,Example: "zo bai baicmvo zo bapli". In general, "fi'o [le se baicvmo] fe'u" must be grammatically equivalent to [le baicmvo". Other criteria for other Lojban-related languages apply as required. column1691: bainri,$x_1$ is an executable/binary file to be run in system/runtime environment $x_2$.,A calque on the English word "binary". The $x_1$ refers more generally to executables, not necessarily binaries. This includes shell scripts and interpreted languages such as Python. The $x_2$ refers to runtime environments, which can be operating systems or more general environments such as virtual machines like the JVM. See also {samrkompli}, which is specifically about compiled programs.,fu'ivla,binary,executable,program,,bainri

column1759: celguntas,$x_1$ is Sagittarius [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].,From shooter (={celgunta}). The Babylonians identified Sagittarius as the god Pabilsaĝ, a strange centaur-like creature firing an arrow from a bow.The sumerian name may be translated as the 'Forefather' or 'Chief Ancestor' (=barda dzena?). In Greek mythology, Sagittarius is identified as a centaur: half human, half horse.,cmevla,Sagittarius,
