column3176: dolna,$x_1$ is a (topological) hole in object $x_2$,Refers to a "hole" in the topological sense, i.e. one which goes all the way through an object, such as a hole in a sheet of paper. For non-topological holes (ones that do not go all the way through, such as a hole in the ground), use {kevna}. See also {canko}, {kalri}, {canlu}. Proposed rafsi -dol-,experimental gismu,hole,,dol,dolna
column3177: dzama,$x1$ performs chore / menial duty / housework / errand $x2$ (nu/ka) for purpose / as obliged by $x3$.,Compare with {zdagu'a}, but much broader in scope, as not limited to house work.  Includes, for example, bills and shopping.  The little tasks we do to maintain our daily lives.  x3 is the motivation for doing the chore, compare {zukte}3.  Suggested rafsi: -zam- and also proposed to steal -dza- from {da}.  See also {bilga}, {gunka}. Generated with gismu algorithm: gismu[...]score.py dzaci, kama, tcor, lata, domashnie, rutini,experimental gismu,chore,errand,housework,,dza,dzama
column3178: dzoli,$x_1$ is recursively related to $x_2$ by applying $x_3$ (number) levels-of-recursion of the predicate-relation $x_4$ (ka with two ce'u),Rafsi -dzo- (when -dzo- is a tertau then seltau corresponds to $x_4$ of {dzoli}). Synonym of {refkusi} for more convenience in making lujvo. tanru example for common usage: 'the day three days from now (tomorrow's tomorrow's tomorrow)' is '{le} {bavlamdeidzo} {be} {fi} {li} {ci}'. Cf. {krefu}, {rapli}, {dzoli}.,experimental gismu,recursion,recursive,splicing,,dzoli
column3179: djiroi,$x_1$ happens as often as $x_2$ desires/wants/wishes in interval $x_3$,,lujvo,as often as desired,
column3180: djisku,$x_1$ expresses/says that they desire $x_2$ (nu/ka) to audience $x_3$ in medium $x_4$, desired for purpose $x_5$,Note that in the past djisku was used for what {skudji} is more commonly used to mean nowadays. The latter is a more regular lujvo and has mostly supplanted the old djisku in usage.,lujvo,express wish,

column3189: donta'a,$x_1$ talks to you (i.e. whoever $x_1$ is addressing) about $x_2$ in language $x_3$,This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL,lujvo,,
column3190: dorcte,$x_{1}$ is the calendar day of event $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$,$x_{2}$ can be {se} {detri}. See also {djecitsi}, {donri}, {detri}, {detydei}.,lujvo,calendar day,
column3191: dorlunra,$x_1$ is a moon of planet $x_2$, visible from location $x_3$ on that planet, where it is daytime.,{dorlurfau} = {nu} {dorlunra},lujvo,day moon,day-moon,daytime moon,
column3192: dorlurfau,$x_1$ is a 'day-moon' event, a time when the moon is visible in daylight.,A translation of the Turkish word günay (literally 'day-moon'), a common surname. From {donri}+{lunra}+{fasnu}.,lujvo,day moon,day-moon,daytime moon,
column3193: dormidju,$m_1$ is the noon (midday) of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.,{djemidju} is too vague. Cf. {donri}, {midju}, {ctemidju}.,lujvo,midday,noon,
column3194: dormijbalvi,$b_1$ is later than noon of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.,{donri}+{midju}+{balvi}; see also {vanci}, {lerci}, {cerni}, {nicte}, {dormidju}, {lecydo'i},lujvo,pm,
column3195: dormijysai,$s_1$ (mass) is a lunch, dinner (midday meal) composed of dishes including $s_2$.,Cf. {cersai}, {vacysai}, {dormidju}, {sanmi}.,lujvo,dejeuner,dinner,lunch,luncheon,tiffin,

column3205: djuriio,$x1$ is a durian (member of genus Durio) of species/cultivar $x2$,,fu'ivla,durian,,djuriio

column3210: djonstiuetMIL,John Stuart Mill,Influential English philosopher, 1806-1873. See also {utliti zei marde}, {vricykricrutrusi'o}.,cmevla,,
column3214: do'ai,discursive & gafyzmico: ignore/kill all following default specifications (permanently),Hereinafter, no terbri will have any default specification unless explicitly given one in the discourse or unless the "official" definition default value is referenced explicitly by the appropriate pro-sumti. See also: {dai'o}, {zmico}, {gafyzmico}, {da'o}.,experimental cmavo,override all default specifications,,,DAhO
column3215: doi'a,gafyzmico: Reset all default specification of the immediately previous word to their respective discourse-external/official definition specifications for this instance/usage only.,Resets all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and {di'au} that may fill the terbri of that word are predefined/specific in reference and do indeed necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-exterior/”official” definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default restoration (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so restored all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. The restoration is only effective for the single occurrence/instant/usage of this word (the next use of the affected word will be implicitly accompanied by its terbri defaults, as defined elsewhere (by official definition or by other (permanent) modifications made to the word)). See also: {dau'a}, {de'oi}, {zmico},experimental cmavo,default reset (across all associated terbri),default restoration (across all associated terbri),,,DEhAU
column3216: doi'au,audience switch marker.,Indicates that the addressee has changed (even if no-one has ever been explicitly specified to have been an audience member); it does not specify who the new addressee is.,experimental cmavo,addressee change,audience change,,,UI
column3217: doi'u,Quotes a word; the result is a pro-sumti for the most recent utterance containing that word.,A useful alternative to {di'u} {de'u} etc. that doesn't make you count utterances.,experimental cmavo,,,,ZO
column3218: djulio,$x_1$ is July in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$,See also: {djanua}, {februa}, {martio}, {prilio}, {madjio}, {djunio}.,obsolete fu'ivla,July,,djulio
column3220: djunio,$x_1$ is June in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$,See also: {djanua}, {februa}, {martio}, {prilio}, {madjio}, {djulio}.,obsolete fu'ivla,June,,djunio
column3222: do'au,pro-sumti whose referent's identity may be chosen by the listener,Short for "lo poi'i do zifre lo ka jdice lo du'u ma kau me ke'a"; e.g. "ko ciksi bau do'au" (explain in any language you like!), "mi ba klama fo do'au" (I'll go, and you're free to choose what route I'll go by), "do'au sivni do" (you're free to keep whatever you want private to yourself). The chosen identity may be plural; the last example shows this is useful. See {nau'o}. Also kind of like {ma}, but instead of "please fill this hole with a truthful thing for my sake (and tell me it)", it's "please fill this hole with a preferred thing for your sake (and act on it)".,experimental cmavo,you-may-choose-what,,,KOhA7
